descriptions_txt:
['Every day we are solving critical business objectives by mining data, performing ad hoc analyses, recommending product, analyzing profitability, building dashboards
and interacting with every part of our business.', 'We need a hardworking individual who can help us move to the next level in all aspects of the data science realm including programming,
quantitative expertise and business expertise.
Responsibilities:
This individual contributor role will support process improvement using coding/automation. The successful candidate will be well versed in Database structures,
query building in Microsoft Access/SQL. The person in this role will help link our analytics with short and long-term business strategy to effectively drive profitable sales.
The Data Analyst/Developer will apply statistical analyses and coding to business problems spanning across various functional areas including product development,
merchandising, and operations. The role requires collaboration with cross-functional partners to yield key business insights and support decision-making.
In addition to having technical capabilities, the ideal candidate is also a curious, diligent and self-motivated problem solver with the ability to manage opposing priorities.
Qualifications and education requirements:', 'Preferred qualifications:', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Pay: $45.00 - $48.00 per hour', 'Benefits:', 'Schedule:', 'Experience:', 'Work Location: Remote']
descriptions_list: ['Experience with SQL', 'Experience with Visual Basic, Python and/or R', 'Statistical techniques such as regression, hypothesis testing, multivariate analysis', 'Experience with machine learning', 'Strong coding skills and knowledge in data structure & algorithms', 'Strong analytical and problem-solving skills', 'Detail oriented, comfortable digging into code and working with imperfect data sets', 'Excellent communication skills and a “can do” demeanor is a must', 'Degree focus in statistics, math, science, engineering or another quantitative field', 'Proven application of advanced techniques in a business setting with impactful results', 'Retail analytics experience', 'Experience with Tableau or PowerBI', 'Experience with at least one of the following: RPA, Blue Prism, Cognos', 'Dental insurance', 'Health insurance', '8 hour shift', 'Monday to Friday', 'SQL: 1 year (Preferred)', 'Python or R: 1 year (Preferred)']

descriptions_txt: ['Looking for a career in which you can make an impact? Join the award-winning IQVIA eCOA team on its journey to disrupt the healthcare industry and improve patients’ clinical research experience.', 'Who we’re looking for:', 'You will be part of a small and growing team of developers located across the US, focused on building new and modern software that’s positioned to revolution the clinical trial space. In this remote role, you’ll be empowered and encouraged to think “outside the box” to develop innovative solutions to drive business and the industry forward. You believe that pushing yourself out of your comfort zone is the only way to grow. You love the idea of owning a product, from developing new mobile app features to scaling to meet market demands. Not only are you fluent with React Native, but you’re experienced with JavaScript/TypeScript.', 'Position overview:', 'We’re seeing immense growth in the industry, and our core focus is scaling our native application’s feature set to meet that growth. Bring your talent and drive to our team of passionate, creative, and innovative thinkers, focused on developing a sophisticated product that uses modern JavaScript. We have the support and resources of a large company but operate with a start-up culture. You’ll thrive in a fast-paced and agile environment, during which you see real-time results. As we work to rapidly expand our team, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in the direction that’s right for you.', 'RESPONSIBILITIES:', 'SKILLS:', 'IQVIA eCOA', "Patients will always be the ultimate customer in healthcare, but they need to be heard. Our goal is to help ensure that each patient is at the center of care and give them a voice to share their story. IQVIA’s eCOA (electronic clinical outcomes assessment) Division has developed an award-winning platform that intelligently automates capturing patient's experiences through real-time, direct-from-patient data collection. This enables the client real-time access to the patient’s experience, which in-turn, improves the treatment and eventual outcome.", 'At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 70,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.', 'All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by applicable law.', 'IQVIA, Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation.']
descriptions_list: ['Serve as critical development resource on cross platform mobile application', 'Work collaboratively and efficiently across functional teams in a fast-paced startup-like environment.', 'High standard of engineering quality through source control, code reviews, continuous integration, and unit tests.', 'Extend our platform to handle an expanding set of features.', 'Improve infrastructure and application development', 'Review and refactor legacy code', 'Provide input on the establishment of development best practices and standards for the organization', '3+ years experience as a software engineer', 'Experience with React (React/Redux/React Native)', 'Software development experience: JavaScript/TypeScript', 'Experience with SQL databases (SQLite/Postgres)', 'Experience with Swift, Objective-C, Java, and Kotlin are a plus', 'Experience with mobile application deployments (Android/iOS)', 'Experience with data/event streams (Amazon Kinesis/Apache Pulsar)', 'Familiarity with a CI/CD tool (CircleCI/AWS CodePipeline)', 'Experience with cloud platforms (AWS)']

job_title: Senior Director, Member Modeling Data Science
descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'Member Modeling Data Science is part of Nike’s Insights function. So you will also be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike, and participate in our data science labs, study groups, and activities, and attend conferences.', 'What you bring', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Lead a talented team of Data Science Directors and Sr Data Scientists. Hire, onboard, and develop additional data scientists and data science directors.', 'Lead workstreams that require cross-functional squads that include data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and product managers.', 'Manage our portfolio of member model capabilities, including lifetime value, segmentation, fraud, and onboarding models.', 'Develop methods and tools that further enrich Nike’s member data while also respecting the privacy of our members.', 'Expand the vision for member modeling at Nike. Learn the business of designing shoes and apparel and bringing them to market around the globe to understand how to best serve stakeholders.', 'Be a part of the broader data science community within Nike and contribute to a culture of learning.', 'Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists.', 'Experience leading through leaders (directors will report into you).', 'Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams.', 'Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders.', 'Experience practicing data science.', 'A product and entrepreneurial mindset.', 'Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education, experience and training.']

job_title: Data Science Director, Global Commercial Analytics (Open to remote work, except in SD, VT, and WV)
descriptions_txt:
['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'Nike’s Commercial Analytics team provides descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive solutions to drive business decisions that ensure consumers have access to the products they want when and where they want them. That’s no easy task! Come help Nike continue to develop our data science team.', 'WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

At Nike, we are always on the offense, and we are looking for an analytics expert who has a robust business acumen and a proven track record of creating measurable impact. The Director, Data Science will manage a team of data scientists to develop and implement new capabilities to enable data-driven and consumer-led decisions for Nike’s commercially oriented functions with a focus on supporting demand planning and supply/inventory planning decisions.', 'Strong candidates are comfortable learning quickly and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment – i.e., they are curious self-starters, flexible problem solvers, outstanding communicators, and disciples of progress over perfection! A team-player attitude is essential, since we value a culture that is collaborative, intellectually curious, and diverse.', 'WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

As the Director, Data Science you will:', 'WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

You will be on the leadership team of Global Commercial Analytics Data Science team. You will collaborate closely with your peers in analytics, business partners, product management, and technology. Core partners include Demand and Supply Management (demand planning, supply and inventory planning) and Supply Chain.', 'Open to remote work, except cannot work in South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.', 'For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $157,500.00 per year. Information about benefits can be found here.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Partner with peer data science leaders to set department’s strategy to enable the design of scalable, end-to-end analytics solutions, and identify and build new opportunities for cross-squad collaboration, increased code sharing across teams, and enhanced scalability of solutions across multiple partner groups. Drive strategy around implementing new data science methodologies and selection of new tools.', 'Partner with analytics product managers to anticipate, identify and facilitate the solution to enterprise issues concerning critical business needs, and support product road-mapping and prioritization decisions across the analytics portfolio.', 'Partner with engineering teams to influence enterprise-level data products, IT architecture, and engineering platform strategies to meet the needs of business and the data science solutions. Help shape Nike’s central data science platform by identifying foundational data science capabilities and creating scalable, reusable, and customizable analytical components.', 'Work with key business partners to understand and anticipate current and future business needs. Evangelize data science and help senior leadership identify business areas where data science will make the biggest impact. Evangelize the value of analytic products through effective storytelling and collaboration with key partners.', 'Keep abreast of technology trends as well as emerging data science tools, techniques, and standard methodologies.', 'Recruit, manage, mentor, and inspire data science team(s); managing performance, goals and development potential. Cultivate professional development opportunities. Help team members establish development goals, set goals with business priorities, develop for the future, and evaluate success.', 'Create and foster an environment that values and promotes diversity and inclusion, autonomy, skill mastery, empowerment, transparency, innovation, and continuous learning', 'Open to remote work, except cannot work in CO, SD, VT, and WV. Candidates will be required to relocate.', '8 years of hands-on engineering experience developing BI systems and working with big data', "Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or related field", 'A strong problem solving and analytical approach. Excels at critical thinking', 'Able to influence and communicate effectively, both verbally and written, with team members, business partners and leadership', 'Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve both people and process related issues', 'Able to influence critical business outcomes in a matrix based, global environment', 'Expert understanding of solution and technical design', 'Excellent communication skills and experience in conveying complex information in easy-to-understand language.', 'Experience in building successful data science teams. Experience leading multiple teams and the development of complex solutions', 'Understand the ecosystem of diverse skills that need to come together to make a large-scale data science project successful. Extensive and/or in-depth knowledge of data science, machine learning, and optimization modeling and algorithms.', 'Demonstrated understanding of market demand and supply interactions. Familiarity with common data sets related to products, consumers, market performance and supply chain.', 'Demonstrated experience in leading technical projects at enterprise scale and managing a team through all stages of Data Science/Analytics lifecycle.', 'Strong familiarity with modern software practices, technologies and programming languages, such as Python, SQL, Git.', 'Strong familiarity with the Agile development process and proven ability to prepare a project plan, communicate the plan to the team and break the work down to trackable tasks.', 'Proven track record of effectively influencing and collaborating with multi-functional partners to identify new opportunities, solve complex business problems and build impactful analytics solutions.', 'Deep knowledge and experience with a diversity of tools and platforms (Prefer experience w/ Python, Spark, AWS or other cloud environments). Able to quickly pick up new programming languages, technologies, and frameworks']

job_title: Statistical and Data Science Innovative Methods Lead
descriptions_txt:
['By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.', 'Takeda is a global, values-based, R&D-driven, top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments, guided by our commitment to patients, our people and the planet.', 'Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics, programming, outcomes research and epidemiology, quantitative clinical pharmacology, digital strategy, library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams, including real-world data and digital tools, and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation.', 'As part of DSI, the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented, collaborative, strong understanding of the
statistical programming function, exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials, contribute to clinical development strategies, perform high quality statistical analyses, and pursue operational excellence.', 'The objectives and overall purpose of this role include:', 'Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D, and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions.', 'Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge.', 'Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical, Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community.', 'Delivery & Business Accountabilities', 'Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods.', 'Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs.', 'Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions, to drive innovative methods development through research, documentation, and education.', 'Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation.', 'Provide statistical leadership and support to selected programs by consulting on study design, endpoints, analysis, interpretation, statistical regulatory strategy, regulatory
responses, and regulatory interactions.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency.', 'Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory, academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians.', 'CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE', 'Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies.', 'Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs, analysis methodology and data interpretation.', 'Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry, overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function.', 'Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design, analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions.', 'Excellent oral and written communications skills.', 'Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases.', 'Strong interpersonal and people management skills.', 'Strong project management skills.', 'Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team.', 'Ability to influence, inspire and motivate others, without direct hierarchical authority, and affect change across organizational boundaries.', 'Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise', 'Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D.', 'Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs.', 'Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends.', 'Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D.', 'The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry, government, and academia.', 'EDUCATION:', 'Applicant for this position should have degree in statistics/biostatistics or in other equivalent quantitative sciences along with the following specific credentials:', 'PhD with ~12+ years experience', 'MS with ~15 years experience', 'BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES', 'An ideal candidate for this position should:', 'Provide strategic leadership', 'Mobilize high performance from teams', 'Influence beyond SQS and DSI', 'Absent an approved religious or medical reason, all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility, and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab, may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application, we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied.', 'This job posting excludes CO applicants.', 'WHAT TAKEDA CAN OFFER YOU:', '401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan', 'Tuition reimbursement Company match of charitable contributions', 'Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings', 'Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days', 'Community Outreach Programs', 'Discover more at takedajobs.com', 'No Phone Calls or Recruiters Please.', 'ADDITIONAL INFORMATION', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.', 'EEO Statement', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.']

descriptions_txt: ['Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup, we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.', 'As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in computing and machine learning technologies and operating across billions of customer records to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time and agony in their financial lives.', 'Role Description\nIn this role, you will:', 'The Ideal Candidate is:', 'Basic Qualifications:', 'Preferred Qualifications:', 'Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.', 'If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.', "For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com", 'Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.', 'Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).']
descriptions_list: ['Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to deliver a product customers love', 'Leverage a broad stack of technologies — Python, Conda, AWS, H2O, Spark, and more — to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data', 'Build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation', 'Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals', 'Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them', 'Creative. You thrive on bringing definition to big, undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You’re not afraid to share a new idea', 'A leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. You’re passionate about talent development for your own team and beyond', 'Technical. You’re comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms.', 'Bachelor’s Degree plus 6 years of experience in data analytics, or Master’s Degree plus 4 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD plus 1 year of experience in data analytics', 'At least 2 years’ experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis', 'At least 2 years’ experience with machine learning', 'At least 2 years’ experience with relational databases', 'PhD in “STEM” field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics', 'At least 1 year of experience working with AWS', 'At least 4 years’ experience in Python, Scala, or R for large scale data analysis', 'At least 4 years’ experience with machine learning', 'At least 4 years’ experience with SQL']

job_title: Data Science Director, Global Commercial Analytics (Open to remote work, except in SD, VT, and WV)
descriptions_txt:
['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'Nike’s Commercial Analytics team provides descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive solutions to drive business decisions that ensure consumers have access to the products they want when and where they want them. That’s no easy task! Come help Nike continue to develop our data science team.', 'WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

At Nike, we are always on the offense, and we are looking for an analytics expert who has a robust business acumen and a proven track record of creating measurable impact. The Director, Data Science will manage a team of data scientists to develop and implement new capabilities to enable data-driven and consumer-led decisions for Nike’s commercially oriented functions with a focus on supporting demand planning and supply/inventory planning decisions.', 'Strong candidates are comfortable learning quickly and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment – i.e., they are curious self-starters, flexible problem solvers, outstanding communicators, and disciples of progress over perfection! A team-player attitude is essential, since we value a culture that is collaborative, intellectually curious, and diverse.', 'WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

As the Director, Data Science you will:', 'WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

You will be on the leadership team of Global Commercial Analytics Data Science team. You will collaborate closely with your peers in analytics, business partners, product management, and technology. Core partners include Demand and Supply Management (demand planning, supply and inventory planning) and Supply Chain.', 'Open to remote work, except cannot work in South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.', 'For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $157,500.00 per year. Information about benefits can be found here.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Partner with peer data science leaders to set department’s strategy to enable the design of scalable, end-to-end analytics solutions, and identify and build new opportunities for cross-squad collaboration, increased code sharing across teams, and enhanced scalability of solutions across multiple partner groups. Drive strategy around implementing new data science methodologies and selection of new tools.', 'Partner with analytics product managers to anticipate, identify and facilitate the solution to enterprise issues concerning critical business needs, and support product road-mapping and prioritization decisions across the analytics portfolio.', 'Partner with engineering teams to influence enterprise-level data products, IT architecture, and engineering platform strategies to meet the needs of business and the data science solutions. Help shape Nike’s central data science platform by identifying foundational data science capabilities and creating scalable, reusable, and customizable analytical components.', 'Work with key business partners to understand and anticipate current and future business needs. Evangelize data science and help senior leadership identify business areas where data science will make the biggest impact. Evangelize the value of analytic products through effective storytelling and collaboration with key partners.', 'Keep abreast of technology trends as well as emerging data science tools, techniques, and standard methodologies.', 'Recruit, manage, mentor, and inspire data science team(s); managing performance, goals and development potential. Cultivate professional development opportunities. Help team members establish development goals, set goals with business priorities, develop for the future, and evaluate success.', 'Create and foster an environment that values and promotes diversity and inclusion, autonomy, skill mastery, empowerment, transparency, innovation, and continuous learning', 'Open to remote work, except cannot work in CO, SD, VT, and WV. Candidates will be required to relocate.', '8 years of hands-on engineering experience developing BI systems and working with big data', "Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or related field", 'A strong problem solving and analytical approach. Excels at critical thinking', 'Able to influence and communicate effectively, both verbally and written, with team members, business partners and leadership', 'Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve both people and process related issues', 'Able to influence critical business outcomes in a matrix based, global environment', 'Expert understanding of solution and technical design', 'Excellent communication skills and experience in conveying complex information in easy-to-understand language.', 'Experience in building successful data science teams. Experience leading multiple teams and the development of complex solutions', 'Understand the ecosystem of diverse skills that need to come together to make a large-scale data science project successful. Extensive and/or in-depth knowledge of data science, machine learning, and optimization modeling and algorithms.', 'Demonstrated understanding of market demand and supply interactions. Familiarity with common data sets related to products, consumers, market performance and supply chain.', 'Demonstrated experience in leading technical projects at enterprise scale and managing a team through all stages of Data Science/Analytics lifecycle.', 'Strong familiarity with modern software practices, technologies and programming languages, such as Python, SQL, Git.', 'Strong familiarity with the Agile development process and proven ability to prepare a project plan, communicate the plan to the team and break the work down to trackable tasks.', 'Proven track record of effectively influencing and collaborating with multi-functional partners to identify new opportunities, solve complex business problems and build impactful analytics solutions.', 'Deep knowledge and experience with a diversity of tools and platforms (Prefer experience w/ Python, Spark, AWS or other cloud environments). Able to quickly pick up new programming languages, technologies, and frameworks']

descriptions_txt: ['As senior member of the Digital Data team, the head of data architecture will play a hands-on leadership role to lead, develop and enhance the data architecture team. He or She will be responsible for the overall data architecture coherence and state of the art data platforms. Digital Data architecture team is in charge of setting the enterprise standards, reviewing and/or implementing solutions and services transversally in collaboration with the different data verticals (Data engineering, Data Dev Ops, visual engineering, Data Domain functions). This leader will ensure internal and external solutions are consistent to the overall strategies across Sanofi, relevant roadmaps, and internal standards where appropriate.', 'The position will report directly to the Global Head of Data architecture Operations and Governance. This role will closely work with multiple transversal Digital teams (e.g. Data, Agile CoE, Consumer Experience, Architecture committees), Digital Technology (e.g. infrastructure, cloud, network, cybersecurity), and key business stakeholders. Efforts will also include developing and reviewing business cases and identifying potential technologies that could support business capabilities and their digital transformations. This resource will have direct people management responsibilities and accountability for several teams:', 'Data Architects – technical solution architects supporting the Digital Data priorities within business & analytic, Real-World evidence, R&D, industrial affairs ...', 'Portfolio and Project Planning – Work closely with the program team and be in charge of defining priorities, resources and budgets.', 'This resource will also drive continuous improvements within their scope inclusive of documentation, processes, governance, success measurement criteria, and operating models.', 'KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:', 'Have solid experience in developing Data architecture roadmaps, blueprints, and designing real world solutions. Experience with both Waterfall and Agile methodologies.', 'Possess practical knowledge of data solutions in business processes and business decisions. Pharmaceutical and life science experience is a nice to have.', 'Demonstrate excellent skills of translating requirements into workable, fit for purpose, technical designs and solutions. Have extensive experience on technical solution identification and rationalization.', 'Previous Hands-on experience in delivering and leading Data Science and machine learning projects', 'Proven experience in all phases of a Big Data/Analytics project: Concept & design, development, implementation, change and operation', 'Advanced experience in programming (Python, SQL, bash)', 'Experience with Docker, Kubernetes/AKS/EKS/Openshift', 'Experience with DevOps, CI/CD and MLOps automation', 'Experience in cloud architecting and machine learning technologies – Azure/AWS/GCP', 'Experience in data technologies Snowflake and other data warehouses, informatica, Kafka, AWS data toolbox, Airflow, databricks, .', 'Experience in designing data and/or machine learning solution architectures', 'Strong customer focus, assertiveness, and precise method of operation', 'Ability in understanding of architectural dependencies of technologies in a vast and complex environment', 'Able to communicate and present internally and externally in a confident manner', 'Proven ability to build develop and lead teams', 'Must be able to quickly adapt to a changing and highly dynamic work environment', 'Strong relationship management skills in working with business colleagues, Digital team members, senior leadership team members, and vendors', 'Demonstrated ability to lead and/or influence decision making', 'Resolve conflicts with tact and diplomacy', 'Ability to communicate clearly and effectively. Fluent in English, both orally and in writing. Other language skills are a plus', 'Ability to work autonomously and work effectively with global teams to get the job done', 'BACKGROUND:', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related scientific or technical disciplines. Advanced degree is preferred. Additional professional certificate is a plus", '>10+ years Data, ML Ops experience is a plus.', 'Strong demonstrated experience in leadership, Implementation and Operational Support, senior stakeholder management, business partnering, and clear, effective communication skills.', 'Experience leading multidisciplinary teams with direct supervisory and people management responsibilities.', 'Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.', '#GD-SA', '#LI-SA', 'At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.']

job_title: Statistical and Data Science Innovative Methods Lead
descriptions_txt:
['By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.', 'Takeda is a global, values-based, R&D-driven, top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments, guided by our commitment to patients, our people and the planet.', 'Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics, programming, outcomes research and epidemiology, quantitative clinical pharmacology, digital strategy, library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams, including real-world data and digital tools, and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation.', 'As part of DSI, the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented, collaborative, strong understanding of the
statistical programming function, exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials, contribute to clinical development strategies, perform high quality statistical analyses, and pursue operational excellence.', 'The objectives and overall purpose of this role include:', 'Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D, and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions.', 'Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge.', 'Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical, Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community.', 'Delivery & Business Accountabilities', 'Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods.', 'Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs.', 'Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions, to drive innovative methods development through research, documentation, and education.', 'Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation.', 'Provide statistical leadership and support to selected programs by consulting on study design, endpoints, analysis, interpretation, statistical regulatory strategy, regulatory
responses, and regulatory interactions.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency.', 'Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory, academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians.', 'CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE', 'Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies.', 'Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs, analysis methodology and data interpretation.', 'Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry, overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function.', 'Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design, analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions.', 'Excellent oral and written communications skills.', 'Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases.', 'Strong interpersonal and people management skills.', 'Strong project management skills.', 'Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team.', 'Ability to influence, inspire and motivate others, without direct hierarchical authority, and affect change across organizational boundaries.', 'Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise', 'Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D.', 'Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs.', 'Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends.', 'Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D.', 'The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry, government, and academia.', 'EDUCATION:', 'Applicant for this position should have degree in statistics/biostatistics or in other equivalent quantitative sciences along with the following specific credentials:', 'PhD with ~12+ years experience', 'MS with ~15 years experience', 'BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES', 'An ideal candidate for this position should:', 'Provide strategic leadership', 'Mobilize high performance from teams', 'Influence beyond SQS and DSI', 'Absent an approved religious or medical reason, all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility, and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab, may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application, we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied.', 'This job posting excludes CO applicants.', 'WHAT TAKEDA CAN OFFER YOU:', '401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan', 'Tuition reimbursement Company match of charitable contributions', 'Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings', 'Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days', 'Community Outreach Programs', 'Discover more at takedajobs.com', 'No Phone Calls or Recruiters Please.', 'ADDITIONAL INFORMATION', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.', 'EEO Statement', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.']

descriptions_txt: ['In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.', 'To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.', 'National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Economics & Load Forecasting Department in Hicksville, NY or Waltham, MA.', 'The Economics & Gas Forecasting team produces the gas load forecasts for National Grid as well economic analysis and insight. As a Lead Data Scientist you will develop, present, and defend the gas and load forecasts for our US service territory using econometric methods. Conduct advanced quantitative analyses and develop sophisticated statistical and machine learning models and optimization tools to help the company achieve its regulatory, financial, operational and growth goals. You will understand policy requirement and help ensure project development be aligned with regulatory perspective. You will support internal stakeholders including Supply, Engineering, Regulatory, Strategy, Finance and others. You will assist in the presentation and defense of the forecasts to regulatory bodies in MA, RI, and NY. You will ensure the forecasts incorporate new distributed energy resources, technologies, and policies.', 'In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.', 'National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.']
descriptions_list:
['Development of gas and electric load forecast using econometric methods. Perform additional analysis relating to the forecast as necessary.', 'Ensure the forecasts properly account for distributed energy resources and new technologies and policies (e.g. energy efficiency, demand response, electrification of heat, etc.).', 'Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business.', 'Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design, customer engagement, marketing campaigns, asset optimization, and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans.', 'Develop, maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation.', 'Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations.', 'Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient, reviewable, and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply, engineering, regulator, strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies, regulatory requirements, market trends, and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use, such as energy efficiency and demand response.', 'Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient, reviewable, and reliable.', 'Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.', 'Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply, engineering, regulator, strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.', 'Stay current in all policies, regulatory requirements, market trends, and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use, such as energy efficiency and demand response.', 'Works well in a team.', 'Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics, engineering, (applied) mathematics, computer science, economics, applied management science, operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus.', 'Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis, machine learning, time series analysis, process modeling, and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred.', 'Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python, R, Matlab, SAS required. Experience in relational databases, stored procedures, SQL, and Non-SQL database systems preferred.', 'Experience in cloud computation preferred', 'Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.', 'Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency, demand response, electric vehicles, PV, storage, electrification of heat, etc.) preferred.', 'Advanced Excel skills required.', 'Power BI/Tableau skills preferred.', 'Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred.', 'Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.']

descriptions_txt: ['In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.', 'To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.', 'National Grid is hiring a Data Science Manager for our Data Science department in Waltham, MA.', 'As a Data Science Manager at National Grid, you will lead a team and do hands-on work. You will work in a dynamic organization to turn data into actionable intelligence. The variety and complexity of challenges you will solve is second to none, but most important is the real world impact your work will have on the lives of millions of people.', 'The National Grid Data Science teams provide insights and conclusions from multiple sources of information in a variety of different formats using analysis techniques that range from simple to advanced. An ability to work cross-functionally and on Agile teams is critical and you should have a broad knowledge of:', 'Preferred Skills and Experience:', 'National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.']

descriptions_txt: ["We are looking for a self-driven, detail oriented, and motivated Sr. Machine Learning Scientist to join our fast-growing team. As a Sr. Machine Learning Scientist, you’ll take the lead researching, developing, and applying cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms to build innovative technologies, services, and products that solve the company's hardest problems and accelerate Best Buy's core growth. In this role you will combine your strong software engineering skills and deep knowledge of ML and AI algorithms to architect, develop, and operationalize models, algorithms, and production quality codebases that form the core engines that unleash the next generation of customer experiences and transform the way Best Buy operates day-to-day."]

descriptions_txt: ['As senior member of the Digital Data team, the head of data architecture will play a hands-on leadership role to lead, develop and enhance the data architecture team. He or She will be responsible for the overall data architecture coherence and state of the art data platforms. Digital Data architecture team is in charge of setting the enterprise standards, reviewing and/or implementing solutions and services transversally in collaboration with the different data verticals (Data engineering, Data Dev Ops, visual engineering, Data Domain functions). This leader will ensure internal and external solutions are consistent to the overall strategies across Sanofi, relevant roadmaps, and internal standards where appropriate.', 'The position will report directly to the Global Head of Data architecture Operations and Governance. This role will closely work with multiple transversal Digital teams (e.g. Data, Agile CoE, Consumer Experience, Architecture committees), Digital Technology (e.g. infrastructure, cloud, network, cybersecurity), and key business stakeholders. Efforts will also include developing and reviewing business cases and identifying potential technologies that could support business capabilities and their digital transformations. This resource will have direct people management responsibilities and accountability for several teams:', 'Data Architects – technical solution architects supporting the Digital Data priorities within business & analytic, Real-World evidence, R&D, industrial affairs ...', 'Portfolio and Project Planning – Work closely with the program team and be in charge of defining priorities, resources and budgets.', 'This resource will also drive continuous improvements within their scope inclusive of documentation, processes, governance, success measurement criteria, and operating models.', 'KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:', 'Have solid experience in developing Data architecture roadmaps, blueprints, and designing real world solutions. Experience with both Waterfall and Agile methodologies.', 'Possess practical knowledge of data solutions in business processes and business decisions. Pharmaceutical and life science experience is a nice to have.', 'Demonstrate excellent skills of translating requirements into workable, fit for purpose, technical designs and solutions. Have extensive experience on technical solution identification and rationalization.', 'Previous Hands-on experience in delivering and leading Data Science and machine learning projects', 'Proven experience in all phases of a Big Data/Analytics project: Concept & design, development, implementation, change and operation', 'Advanced experience in programming (Python, SQL, bash)', 'Experience with Docker, Kubernetes/AKS/EKS/Openshift', 'Experience with DevOps, CI/CD and MLOps automation', 'Experience in cloud architecting and machine learning technologies – Azure/AWS/GCP', 'Experience in data technologies Snowflake and other data warehouses, informatica, Kafka, AWS data toolbox, Airflow, databricks, .', 'Experience in designing data and/or machine learning solution architectures', 'Strong customer focus, assertiveness, and precise method of operation', 'Ability in understanding of architectural dependencies of technologies in a vast and complex environment', 'Able to communicate and present internally and externally in a confident manner', 'Proven ability to build develop and lead teams', 'Must be able to quickly adapt to a changing and highly dynamic work environment', 'Strong relationship management skills in working with business colleagues, Digital team members, senior leadership team members, and vendors', 'Demonstrated ability to lead and/or influence decision making', 'Resolve conflicts with tact and diplomacy', 'Ability to communicate clearly and effectively. Fluent in English, both orally and in writing. Other language skills are a plus', 'Ability to work autonomously and work effectively with global teams to get the job done', 'BACKGROUND:', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related scientific or technical disciplines. Advanced degree is preferred. Additional professional certificate is a plus", '>10+ years Data, ML Ops experience is a plus.', 'Strong demonstrated experience in leadership, Implementation and Operational Support, senior stakeholder management, business partnering, and clear, effective communication skills.', 'Experience leading multidisciplinary teams with direct supervisory and people management responsibilities.', 'Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.', '#GD-SA', '#LI-SA', 'At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.']

job_title: Statistical and Data Science Innovative Methods Lead
descriptions_txt:
['By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.', 'Takeda is a global, values-based, R&D-driven, top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments, guided by our commitment to patients, our people and the planet.', 'Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics, programming, outcomes research and epidemiology, quantitative clinical pharmacology, digital strategy, library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams, including real-world data and digital tools, and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation.', 'As part of DSI, the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented, collaborative, strong understanding of the
statistical programming function, exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials, contribute to clinical development strategies, perform high quality statistical analyses, and pursue operational excellence.', 'The objectives and overall purpose of this role include:', 'Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D, and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions.', 'Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge.', 'Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical, Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community.', 'Delivery & Business Accountabilities', 'Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods.', 'Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs.', 'Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions, to drive innovative methods development through research, documentation, and education.', 'Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation.', 'Provide statistical leadership and support to selected programs by consulting on study design, endpoints, analysis, interpretation, statistical regulatory strategy, regulatory
responses, and regulatory interactions.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency.', 'Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory, academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians.', 'CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE', 'Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies.', 'Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs, analysis methodology and data interpretation.', 'Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry, overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function.', 'Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design, analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions.', 'Excellent oral and written communications skills.', 'Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases.', 'Strong interpersonal and people management skills.', 'Strong project management skills.', 'Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team.', 'Ability to influence, inspire and motivate others, without direct hierarchical authority, and affect change across organizational boundaries.', 'Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise', 'Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D.', 'Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs.', 'Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends.', 'Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D.', 'The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry, government, and academia.', 'EDUCATION:', 'Applicant for this position should have degree in statistics/biostatistics or in other equivalent quantitative sciences along with the following specific credentials:', 'PhD with ~12+ years experience', 'MS with ~15 years experience', 'BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES', 'An ideal candidate for this position should:', 'Provide strategic leadership', 'Mobilize high performance from teams', 'Influence beyond SQS and DSI', 'Absent an approved religious or medical reason, all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility, and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab, may be subject to different guidelines. job_title: Senior Data Scientist, SNKRS and Fairness
descriptions_txt:
['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'SNKRS & NBHD comprise Nike’s consumer-led streetwear ecosystem. This multi-disciplinary team creates inspired, brand-defining, and inclusive products, stories, experiences, and business models that harness the energy from our communities, shape culture, and create lasting emotional bonds with our consumers.', 'WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We’re looking for data scientists with industry experience and a passion for understanding consumer behavior. The role requires both the mathematical rigor to develop predictive and descriptive models as well as the creativity to identify new opportunities to bring value through data-driven insights and innovation. The candidate should have a history of collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams, delivering work on time against a roadmap, and sharing their work with non-technical audiences. A bias for action, an entrepreneurial spirit, and demonstrated ability to work in a rapidly changing environment are also essential.', 'WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

In this role, you will apply contemporary data science and analytics methods to', 'WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

As part of the SNKRS + NBHD Data Science and Analytics team, you will be working with other data scientists and analysts as well as a diverse range of multi-functional business partners. The team is in Nike’s Direct Analytics org and Insights function.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Extract consumer preferences and tendencies from event streams', 'Develop algorithms to target and reward our most deserving members', 'Predict which consumers and how many are likely to want to purchase upcoming footwear and apparel', 'Create models and simulations to understand marketplace dynamics', 'Design and analyze experiments to illuminate causality', 'Be a strategic partner to business team members and lead research and analysis to inform business strategy', 'Build stakeholder-facing tools to support decision-making', 'Create clear and structured work to clearly communicate significant insights to a non-technical audience', "Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Business, Psychology, Economics, or similarly quantitative.", 'Minimum 5 years of relevant professional experience in analytics or data science', 'Experience working with real-world, large data sets (>100GB)', 'Ability to work in multiple data environments and perform complex joins, data cleaning, and feature creation using SQL or SQL-based languages (e.g., Hive)', 'Significant experience coding in Python', 'Demonstrable experience building positive working relationships in multi-functional teams, including demonstrated success in managing through influence.', 'Demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision-making through compelling storytelling and presentations to executive-level partners.', 'Track record of owning high-impact work from idea to delivery', 'Ability to manage multiple tracks of work and requirements delivered on time and accurately.', 'Plus: advanced degree in quantitative field', 'Plus: experience with rigorous experimentation', 'Plus: experience creating data products and dashboards (e.g., in Tableau)', 'Plus: passion for Nike sneakers and streetwear culture.']
