descriptions_txt: ['In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.', 'To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.', 'National Grid is hiring a Data Science Manager for our Data Science department in Waltham, MA.', 'As a Data Science Manager at National Grid, you will lead a team and do hands-on work. You will work in a dynamic organization to turn data into actionable intelligence. The variety and complexity of challenges you will solve is second to none, but most important is the real world impact your work will have on the lives of millions of people.', 'The National Grid Data Science teams provide insights and conclusions from multiple sources of information in a variety of different formats using analysis techniques that range from simple to advanced. An ability to work cross-functionally and on Agile teams is critical and you should have a broad knowledge of:', 'Preferred Skills and Experience:', 'National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.']

descriptions_txt: ['In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.', 'To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.', 'National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Economics & Load Forecasting Department in Hicksville, NY or Waltham, MA.', 'The Economics & Gas Forecasting team produces the gas load forecasts for National Grid as well economic analysis and insight. As a Lead Data Scientist you will develop, present, and defend the gas and load forecasts for our US service territory using econometric methods. Conduct advanced quantitative analyses and develop sophisticated statistical and machine learning models and optimization tools to help the company achieve its regulatory, financial, operational and growth goals. You will understand policy requirement and help ensure project development be aligned with regulatory perspective. You will support internal stakeholders including Supply, Engineering, Regulatory, Strategy, Finance and others. You will assist in the presentation and defense of the forecasts to regulatory bodies in MA, RI, and NY. You will ensure the forecasts incorporate new distributed energy resources, technologies, and policies.', 'In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.', 'National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.']
descriptions_list:
['Development of gas and electric load forecast using econometric methods. Perform additional analysis relating to the forecast as necessary.', 'Ensure the forecasts properly account for distributed energy resources and new technologies and policies (e.g. energy efficiency, demand response, electrification of heat, etc.).', 'Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business.', 'Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design, customer engagement, marketing campaigns, asset optimization, and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans.', 'Develop, maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation.', 'Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations.', 'Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient, reviewable, and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply, engineering, regulator, strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies, regulatory requirements, market trends, and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use, such as energy efficiency and demand response.', 'Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient, reviewable, and reliable.', 'Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.', 'Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply, engineering, regulator, strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.', 'Stay current in all policies, regulatory requirements, market trends, and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use, such as energy efficiency and demand response.', 'Works well in a team.', 'Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics, engineering, (applied) mathematics, computer science, economics, applied management science, operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus.', 'Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis, machine learning, time series analysis, process modeling, and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred.', 'Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python, R, Matlab, SAS required. Experience in relational databases, stored procedures, SQL, and Non-SQL database systems preferred.', 'Experience in cloud computation preferred', 'Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.', 'Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency, demand response, electric vehicles, PV, storage, electrification of heat, etc.) preferred.', 'Advanced Excel skills required.', 'Power BI/Tableau skills preferred.', 'Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred.', 'Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.']

descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'We are looking for a Manager, Data Visualization and User Experience to join the Data Products & Reporting team within the larger Commercial Analytics organization. The person in this role will develop a team of visualization developers who sit on multi-functional agile squads responsible for delivering data products to enhance decision making across Nike’s Global functions. The candidate is an effective technologist, passionate about evolving toolsets, and approaches all new development empathetic to the user experience. You will implement and support the ongoing effort to use visualization standards, tool assessment methodologies, and training approach across squads. You drive a collaborative culture of shared standard methodologies with direct management over a diverse team of development resources. You know how to enable people to be successful by removing obstacles, empowering your team, and partnering across functions. While you rely on data to prove your point, you love to think in an unexpected way and solve problems creatively. You are intellectually curious, and consistently recognize opportunities to understand and resolve business problems with data. You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, and you are excited by the challenge of building something from the ground up. You are comfortable leading in an ambiguous environment and developing repeatable frameworks to improve team efficiency.', 'As part of the Data Products and Reporting Visualization team led by the Director of Visualization and User Experience while partnering closely with Data Engineering and Enterprise Platform leaders. You will collaborate across our broader organization with business teams as well as other data, analytics and technology functions at Nike.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. descriptions_list: ['Development of sophisticated data visualization and self-service data products that lead to improved performance and accomplishment of strategic and/or operational goals', 'Own relationships with diverse business partners to understand current and future customer and business needs, elicit platform requirements, and define relevant strategic questions', 'Develop and lead data visualization professionals responsible for building and deepening an integrated view of Nike’s supply chain and consumers through data and analytics', 'Support and evolve best practices and standards for all cycles of visual product development including requirements, prototyping, code development, code/asset management and versioning, documentation, and maintenance.', 'Actively evaluate and continuously improve the approach, toolset, and implementation of visual analytics and reporting', 'Partner across data science and other functional teams to accelerate and use visualization strategies, data capabilities, and insights as part of the company’s integrated data offense', 'Evolve analytics capabilities and champion visualization and dashboarding standard methodologies for UI/UX development, data quality, deployment, and sustainable maintenance, including fast, iterative experimentation and measurement', "Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Technology, Computer Science or other related fields preferred. Will accept suitable combination of education and experience.", '5+ years of relevant experience developing dashboards, data visualizations, analytical reports, and self-service tools', '2+ years leading or mentoring teams developing analytic tools, visual analytics, sophisticated analytics, or related practices Expert level proficiency in SQL', 'High business acumen, with a passion for business reporting, analysis, and working with business intelligence tools and large amounts of data', 'Proven history of analytical leadership', 'In-depth experience in solving sophisticated problems through data and analytics, including providing insights that are logical, data driven, simple to understand and aligned to business goals', 'Experience working hand-in-hand with key partners (teams, portfolio managers, product or merchandising managers, leaders, etc.) to design and build data visualizations to support business performance and goals', 'Ability to develop strong partnerships across a multi-layered, fast moving, results-driven organization', 'Relevant experience in user-centered design and capturing and communicating user needs and coaching developers to promote these methods', 'Experience in navigating sophisticated business relationships while ensuring products are designed for optimal user experience and have measurable criteria for success', 'Expertise with visual analysis technologies such as Tableau, Domo, Power BI, SAS, QlikView, JavaScript, or similar tools', 'Knowledge developing in cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and AWS; MPP, Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Impala, Hive, MongoDB, HBase, or Cassandra', 'Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills – a visual and verbal storyteller who can guide and develop these skills across the team', 'Expertise in data warehousing, dimensional modeling, and the ability to drive standard methodologies in data management and governance', 'Solid understanding of various database management systems like Oracle, MySQL, Teradata, Netezza, SQL Server, or DB2, as well as proficiency in working with large data sets.']

descriptions_txt: ['By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.', 'At Takeda, we are a forward-looking, world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments, we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide.', "Join Takeda as a Head, ShinrAI Center for Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning. Takeda's ShinrAI Center for AI/ML is the newly created Center of Excellence for AI/ML. Shinrai is the Japanese word for trust. The ShinrAI Center for AI/ML represents the hub of data scientists, statisticians, and data engineers that will build algorithms that can be trusted by peers, colleagues, and patients. As part of the Data Architecture and Digital Solutions team, you will report to the Head of Data Architecture and Digital Solutions.", 'At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.', 'Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.', 'Absent an approved religious or medical reason, all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility, and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab, may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application, we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied.', 'In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.', '#LI-SGM', 'EEO Statement', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.']

descriptions_txt: ['Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup, we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.', 'As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in computing and machine learning technologies and operating across billions of customer records to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time and agony in their financial lives.', 'Role Description\nIn this role, you will:', 'The Ideal Candidate is:', 'Basic Qualifications:', 'Preferred Qualifications:', 'Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.', 'If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.', "For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com", 'Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.', 'Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).']
descriptions_list: ['Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to deliver a product customers love', 'Leverage a broad stack of technologies — Python, Conda, AWS, H2O, Spark, and more — to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data', 'Build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation', 'Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals', 'Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them', 'Creative. You thrive on bringing definition to big, undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You’re not afraid to share a new idea', 'A leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. You’re passionate about talent development for your own team and beyond', 'Technical. You’re comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms.', 'Bachelor’s Degree plus 6 years of experience in data analytics, or Master’s Degree plus 4 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD plus 1 year of experience in data analytics', 'At least 2 years’ experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis', 'At least 2 years’ experience with machine learning', 'At least 2 years’ experience with relational databases', 'PhD in “STEM” field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics', 'At least 1 year of experience working with AWS', 'At least 4 years’ experience in Python, Scala, or R for large scale data analysis', 'At least 4 years’ experience with machine learning', 'At least 4 years’ experience with SQL']
pros: ['"The work life balance is good" (in 90 reviews)', '"Good benefits and on" (in 54 reviews)', '"The culture is great!" (in 84 reviews)', '"life balance; good pay" (in 69 reviews)', '"Great people and great perks including flexibility" (in 52 reviews)']
cons: ['"No Work life balance at all" (in 90 reviews)', '"Competitive culture, promotion culture, strict development program" (in 84 reviews)', '"Pay could be better but overall compensation package makes up" (in 69 reviews)', '"sometimes people weren\'t always that excited." (in 52 reviews)']

descriptions_txt: ['In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.', 'To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.', 'National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Economics & Load Forecasting Department in Hicksville, NY or Waltham, MA.', 'The Economics & Gas Forecasting team produces the gas load forecasts for National Grid as well economic analysis and insight. As a Lead Data Scientist you will develop, present, and defend the gas and load forecasts for our US service territory using econometric methods. Conduct advanced quantitative analyses and develop sophisticated statistical and machine learning models and optimization tools to help the company achieve its regulatory, financial, operational and growth goals. You will understand policy requirement and help ensure project development be aligned with regulatory perspective. You will support internal stakeholders including Supply, Engineering, Regulatory, Strategy, Finance and others. You will assist in the presentation and defense of the forecasts to regulatory bodies in MA, RI, and NY. You will ensure the forecasts incorporate new distributed energy resources, technologies, and policies.', 'In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety, National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation.', 'This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.', 'National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.']
descriptions_list:
['Development of gas and electric load forecast using econometric methods. Perform additional analysis relating to the forecast as necessary.', 'Ensure the forecasts properly account for distributed energy resources and new technologies and policies (e.g. energy efficiency, demand response, electrification of heat, etc.).', 'Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business.', 'Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design, customer engagement, marketing campaigns, asset optimization, and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans.', 'Develop, maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation.', 'Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations.', 'Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient, reviewable, and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply, engineering, regulator, strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies, regulatory requirements, market trends, and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use, such as energy efficiency and demand response.', 'Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient, reviewable, and reliable.', 'Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.', 'Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply, engineering, regulator, strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.', 'Stay current in all policies, regulatory requirements, market trends, and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use, such as energy efficiency and demand response.', 'Works well in a team.', 'Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics, engineering, (applied) mathematics, computer science, economics, applied management science, operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus.', 'Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis, machine learning, time series analysis, process modeling, and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred.', 'Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python, R, Matlab, SAS required. Experience in relational databases, stored procedures, SQL, and Non-SQL database systems preferred.', 'Experience in cloud computation preferred', 'Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.', 'Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency, demand response, electric vehicles, PV, storage, electrification of heat, etc.) preferred.', 'Advanced Excel skills required.', 'Power BI/Tableau skills preferred.', 'Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred.', 'Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.']
pros: ['"Good work life balance (Depending on the team you are in)" (in 14 reviews)', '"Stability and the people themselves are nice" (in 19 reviews)', '"Good Pay and Benefits." (in 14 reviews)', '"Good management" (in 12 reviews)', '"Great culture, even while working from home!" (in 18 reviews)']
cons: ['"Depending on what team you are on you can either have a great work life balance or a very poor work life balance." (in 12 reviews)']

job_title: Statistical and Data Science Innovative Methods Lead
descriptions_txt:
['By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.', 'Takeda is a global, values-based, R&D-driven, top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments, guided by our commitment to patients, our people and the planet.', 'Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics, programming, outcomes research and epidemiology, quantitative clinical pharmacology, digital strategy, library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams, including real-world data and digital tools, and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation.', 'As part of DSI, the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented, collaborative, strong understanding of the
statistical programming function, exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials, contribute to clinical development strategies, perform high quality statistical analyses, and pursue operational excellence.', 'The objectives and overall purpose of this role include:', 'Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D, and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions.', 'Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge.', 'Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical, Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community.', 'Delivery & Business Accountabilities', 'Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods.', 'Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs.', 'Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions, to drive innovative methods development through research, documentation, and education.', 'Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation.', 'Provide statistical leadership and support to selected programs by consulting on study design, endpoints, analysis, interpretation, statistical regulatory strategy, regulatory
responses, and regulatory interactions.', 'Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency.', 'Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda.', 'Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory, academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians.', 'CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE', 'Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies.', 'Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs, analysis methodology and data interpretation.', 'Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry, overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function.', 'Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design, analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions.', 'Excellent oral and written communications skills.', 'Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases.', 'Strong interpersonal and people management skills.', 'Strong project management skills.', 'Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team.', 'Ability to influence, inspire and motivate others, without direct hierarchical authority, and affect change across organizational boundaries.', 'Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise', 'Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D.', 'Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs.', 'Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends.', 'Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D.', 'The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry, government, and academia.', 'EDUCATION:', 'Applicant for this position should have degree in statistics/biostatistics or in other equivalent quantitative sciences along with the following specific credentials:', 'PhD with ~12+ years experience', 'MS with ~15 years experience', 'BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES', 'An ideal candidate for this position should:', 'Provide strategic leadership', 'Mobilize high performance from teams', 'Influence beyond SQS and DSI', 'Absent an approved religious or medical reason, all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility, and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab, may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application, we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied.', 'This job posting excludes CO applicants.', 'WHAT TAKEDA CAN OFFER YOU:', '401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan', 'Tuition reimbursement Company match of charitable contributions', 'Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings', 'Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days', 'Community Outreach Programs', 'Discover more at takedajobs.com', 'No Phone Calls or Recruiters Please.', 'ADDITIONAL INFORMATION', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.', 'EEO Statement', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.']

job_title: Senior Director, Consumer Science & Insights - Jordan NA
descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'We are looking for a Sr. Director, Consumer Insights and Analytics. This role will lead “the voice of the Jordan consumer” and provide meaningful data-based insights. We need this individual to bring a strategic perspective on the consumer and their relationship to basketball culture. We need a strong, influential leader with deep expertise in driving insights, analytics, and strategy!', 'This role will be a critical part of the leadership team of Global Jordan Consumer Science + Insights team and the lead for North America Jordan Brand Insights and Analytics.', 'Through partnership with the other marketplace units with strong functional expertise, this team powers the geography’s consumer strategy applying quantitative and qualitative methods at the pace of the consumer.', 'The Sr. Director will partner across other multi-disciplinary analytics teams at Nike and Jordan, building and owning relationships with diverse business partners. You will also partner with Gender Leaders within Jordan North America to prioritize opportunities and build a pipeline of insights and data that helps inform every aspect of our value chain.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Synthesize quantitative and qualitative data to drive macro business strategies that will enable North America to reach its revenue goals through the gender offense leading with a deep understanding of Jordan consumers and Nike Direct members', 'Be the advocate for the Jordan Brand consumer in North America ensuring we are meeting their needs in an evolving marketplace by influencing analytics work done across the analytics functions: Nike Direct, Commercial and Reporting', 'Evangelize fact-based decision making at the Jordan Brand leadership table – partnering with North America Jordan Team, Gender functional leaders (Nike) and their teams to improve data literacy and elevate the role of insights to inform long term strategies and seasonal planning/execution', 'Influence the Global Jordan Brand agenda on behalf of the geography by elevating data', 'infused priorities that will be surfaced to the global gender table through the Jordan Brand North America GM in partnership with Global Consumer Market Research', 'Find opportunities to drive growth aligned with North America strategic priorities', "Bachelor's degree or higher or equivalent combination of education and experience and training", '10+ years in Data Science, Advanced Analytics and/or Consumer Insights', 'Applied experience interpreting qualitative and quantitative data to drive business decisions that will enable membership and revenue growth across the integrated marketplace in North America.', '5 or more years of demonstrated ability influencing a multidisciplinary team and a proven history of analytical team leadership, communications and building business partner relationships', 'Validated achievements in solving real-world advanced analytics challenges and leading a sophisticated portfolio and multiple partners in a fast paced, dynamic and matrixed team and business environment', 'Experience building and implementing strategic business processes within a large organization including working with technology partners to deliver information solutions', 'Excellent written, presentation and verbal communication up to the senior executive level and out to wide, diverse audiences', 'Ability to successfully navigate a highly matrixed organization and work closely with teams across segments of the company', 'Familiarity with very large data sources and best-in-class research methods and applied statistics, including sampling approaches, causal modeling, time series analysis, and data-mining techniques in collecting and predicting consumer sentiment, behavior, and feedback']
pros: ['"Great work life balance" (in 45 reviews)', '"Benefits is great." (in 34 reviews)', '"Great People that work hard and love to celebrate anything" (in 43 reviews)', '"Campus is beautiful and facilities are great (pre" (in 52 reviews)', '"Love it here, great pay" (in 46 reviews)']
cons: ['"Work life balance takes a hit, 24/7 support" (in 45 reviews)', '"If you\'re in IT, you\'ll never be on the beautiful campus" (in 52 reviews)', '"Pay is decent, but they cannot compete with tech companies" (in 46 reviews)']

descriptions_txt: ["It's not every day we have a chance to make the world a healthier place—but here, it’s our way of life. Idealistic? Maybe. Deeply pragmatic? Always. Real Chemistry is a global health innovation company that has carved out its space at the intersection between healthcare, marketing and communications, tech, and the people at the heart of it all. It’s with a great sense of purpose that we work together with brave health and wellness companies to create and inspire healthier, happier, and longer lives. It’s our passion. And if you’re still reading, we’re guessing it might be yours too. We are looking to add to our alchemic mix of more than 2,000 talented professionals. At Real Chemistry, we don’t just wish the world was healthier. We leverage tech, data and creativity to make it so. You in?", 'Job Summary', 'We’re looking for an entry level data scientist to join our Data Science team. Applicants should be curious, driven and interested in finding data-driven, evidence-based answers to hard problems. You will work side-by-side with our team of data scientists, account staff, and analysts to find creative solutions to the hardest business problems from some of the biggest brands in the world like Intel, Red Bull, and Takeda Pharmaceutical Company.', 'Our data sciences team splits its time between creating the best products in the marketplace; building and maintaining our data and tools platforms; and working directly with analysts to make sure every project is putting the best data, the smartest algorithms, and the most efficient processes to work for our clients. The data sciences team members collaborate on a variety of projects and have a diversity of technical talent including computer science, statistics, machine learning, information systems, and engineering. We work on a wide range of infrastructure, ranging from python notebooks to cloud computing.', 'Responsibilities', 'Partner with analytics team to deliver data-driven answers to clients’ complex business questions', 'Collaborate and communicate effectively with stakeholders from teams in data sciences, analytics, account managers, and creative', 'Assist in executing the plan by pulling data, applying algorithms, etc.', 'Compose the right research plan for the project', 'Craft the narrative to explain the results to internal and client stakeholders', 'Develop new data sets and tools to answer clients’ business questions better', 'Discover new patterns in available data', 'Develop prototypes of new products and solutions', 'Assemble new data sets', 'Support the software team in growing and maintaining data and tools platform', 'Drive integration of new data, algorithms, and prototypes into the tools', 'Required Skills & Experience', 'A Bachelors, Masters or Doctoral degree in Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, Engineering, Statistics, Machine Learning, Natural Sciences, Mathematics, Economics, or any other related quantitative field', 'A knack for explaining complex concepts in simple terms', 'Experience using Python to manage and modify data', 'Project experience in data collection, knowledge engineering, machine learning, computational linguistics, or data modeling', 'Real Chemistry is currently operating with a flexible, hybrid approach and giving our teams the ability to operate in the way that works best for them – at home, in office or a mix. * We trust our people to decide what works best for them, working together with their teams and leaders to support our customers and make the world a healthier place. This policy will continue to be evaluated and may change in the future as we seek to ensure our people stay inspired, engaged, and motivated to do their best work.', '*All employees who work in a Real Chemistry office, travel for business, or attend a Real Chemistry sponsored event must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees who qualify for a religious or medical exemption to receiving a COVID-19 vaccine are advised to work with our People team for accommodation.', 'Real Chemistry offers a comprehensive benefit program and perks, including flexible PTO, expanded paid leave for new parents including Your 4th Trimester ® , a program that helps new parents transition back to work, and a five-week sabbatical program. Other perks include Income Protection, Retirement plans/401(k) match, and cell phone savings plans. Learn more about our great benefits and perks at: https://www.realchemistry.com/', 'Real Chemistry is committed to being an Equal Opportunity employer. As such, we seek motivated and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, ethnic or national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, marital information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Real Chemistry operates. We strive to employ, motivate, advance and reasonably accommodate any qualified employees and applicants. We believe diversity of persons and ideas forms the most comprehensive, forward-looking company.']

descriptions_txt: ["Remote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance (learn more about how it works). We're backed by A+ investors and our team is world-class, literally and figuratively, as we're all scattered around the world.", 'Please check out our public handbook to learn more about our culture. We encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age and abilities to apply. You can also check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor. If this job description resonates with you, we want to hear from you!', 'All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!', 'We love working async and this means you get to do your own schedule.', 'We empower ownership and proactivity and when in doubt default to action instead of waiting.', "As a Data Analyst, you will be the link between data producers and data consumers at Remote. You'll primarily focus on building out our data pipeline to unify our various data sources in a compliant manner. That being said, you should also be able to jump in as needed and help deliver consumable data to internal users.", 'Remote’s Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair unbiased compensation and fair pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labour practices and therefore pay a minimum annual salary of USD 40,000 per year, in all locations throughout the world. Actual compensation may vary based upon geographical location, experience, and/or skill level. However, it will never be below our minimum global compensation mentioned.', "You can learn more about the benefits we're offering to all internal employees at Remote by visiting our public Benefits & Perks Handbook page.", 'Please fill out the form below. Thank you!']

descriptions_txt: ['Consultant/Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III', 'The Innova Group is searching for a qualified Consultant/ Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III to join our multidisciplinary planning team and support all aspects of project research, analysis, and deliverable development. The selected candidate for this position will analyze, assist, and develop innovative planning solutions for strategic, operational and/or facility planning issues for a multitude of service lines with healthcare system clients. The most successful candidates will demonstrate skills and experience in a blend of data science, analytics, data management, and healthcare planning.', 'The Innova Group is a Healthcare Planning Consultancy with offices and staff in Austin, Atlanta, Boston, Dallas, Denver, Minneapolis, Portland, St. Louis, Tucson, and Washington DC. Since 1995, we have been developing innovative solutions in healthcare strategy, operations, and facility planning, both nationally and overseas. We offer a small, entrepreneurial team culture with direct leadership mentoring, training, and involvement.', 'We work primarily on the “pre-design” portion of a capital investment project to build healthcare facilities —working with clients to ensure the project meets strategic, financial, and operational goals— setting the table for architectural design and real estate acquisition process. The Innova Group is a source of strategic healthcare planning and consulting services for large private systems such as Kaiser Permanente and Dignity Health, academic medical centers such as the University of New Mexico, community hospitals, and public sector systems such as the Military Health Service, Indian Health Service, and Veterans Affairs. More information on our firm is available at www.theinnovagroup.com.', 'Salary Range: Level II: $65,000-100,000, Level III: $100,000-150,000, dependent upon experience and qualifications', 'Job Description', 'Qualifications Required', 'Statistics, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Architecture, GIS, or other data/analysis intensive major', 'Technical Skills Considered', 'Location/Benefits/Travel', 'These positions are being offered nation-wide with preferences for communities with an existing Innova presence and Tucson. Depending on experience, the Healthcare Planner II positions may require an in- office position in Austin, Dallas, Denver, Minneapolis, St. Louis, or Tucson. We offer paid vacation, healthcare, healthcare savings account, 401K, and profit-sharing benefits. Compensation will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. Six to ten days travel per month may be required of this position.', 'Application Requirements', 'Interested individuals should submit an electronic (word or pdf) copy of their resume with a cover letter. A cover letter is essential and should clearly identify your career goal, your rationale for applying, a summary of your education and past work experience, and why you are a good fit for the position. Submissions without a cover letter will not be accepted.', 'All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.', 'Job Type: Full-time', 'Pay: $65,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year', 'Benefits:', 'Schedule:', 'Ability to commute/relocate:', 'Application Question(s):', 'Education:', 'Experience:', 'Willingness to travel:', 'Work Location: Multiple Locations']
descriptions_list: ['Acquire, normalize, and analyze multi-sector medical data (patient/facility/physician) utilized in modeling healthcare delivery and developing operational alternatives for healthcare systems', 'Forecast future healthcare utilization through trend analysis and extrapolation', 'Present and display data, analysis, and findings to help clients make decisions', 'Demonstrate expertise utilizing healthcare strategy, planning metrics, and emerging trends to define operational processes and resource requirements (capital, space, and staff) in healthcare planning documents for clinical staff, administrators, and architects', 'Assist and conduct strategy, operations, and facility evaluations', 'Assist and conduct Facility Master Plans and Regional Health Care System planning', 'Lead, facilitate, guide, and oversee analysis and planning on multiple project types and client sectors', 'Bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in one of the following programs: Healthcare, Business,', 'Level II: 4 -10 years of experience in healthcare strategy, operations, and/or facility planning', 'Level III: 10-15 years of experience in healthcare strategy, operations, and/or facility planning', 'Broad knowledge of healthcare services, delivery models, data sets, related codes, and facility, finance, and/or operation related planning metrics', 'Ability to create and communicate relevant solutions to complex problems through thoughtful and analysis', 'Public Speaking', 'Demonstrated team player with mentoring and/or leadership skills', 'MS Office: Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel (intermediate proficiency required - Pivot tables, complex “if” statements, conditional formatting)', 'SQL: intermediate proficiency (import data, indices, query/table development, CTE creation, etc.).', 'Database and/or application development skills', 'GIS Experience', 'Graphics capability (Graphic Design/Media/Other Dimensions)', 'Business Intelligence Tools o Tableau o Power Bi', 'Experience related to Innova core sectors (healthcare strategy/operations/facility planning)', 'Familiarity with CAD standards/procedures, as well as Revit, are desirable but not required.', 'When attaching your resume, please use following filename style: " last name_first name_resume.doc/pdf" (for example, if your name was Chris Miller and you were submitting a pdf file, your resume would be saved as "miller_chris_resume.pdf". Your cover letter may be copy/pasted directly into the box provided in the Indeed.com submission process.', 'The Innova Group does not compensate candidates for travel expenses associated with interviewing, unless otherwise indicated at the time of call for interview.', '401(k)', 'Dental insurance', 'Health insurance', 'Paid time off', 'Vision insurance', 'Monday to Friday', 'Dallas, TX: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)', 'Are you comfortable with public speaking?', 'Do you presently hold a leadership or mentoring position within your current organization?', 'How many years of healthcare operations experience do you have?', 'How many years of healthcare strategy experience do you have?', 'How many years of facility planning experience do you have?', 'Are you willing to relocate to Tucson, Austin, or Dallas, where The Innova Group has a presence?', "Bachelor's (Required)", 'Healthcare management: 4 years (Required)', '50% (Preferred)']

job_title: DATA ANALYTICS MANAGER I (GLOBAL COMMERCIAL ANALYTICS- S&IP OPTIMIZATION)
descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', "NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.", 'Analytics is a competitive differentiator for Nike and is fundamentally changing how the company serves athletes and consumers around the world. The Nike Commercial Analytics team builds analytic-based solutions to manage marketplace and optimize the supply chain. Using big data, advanced analytics and state-of-the-art technology, the team strives to ensure that Nike gets the right product to the right place at the right time for the consumers.', 'We are looking for a Data Analytics Manager I to join the Supply and Inventory Planning Optimization (SIPO) team within the larger Commercial Analytics organization. This role will be part of a multi-functional agile squad responsible for building predictive and prescriptive analytic solutions to enhance the supply and inventory decision making across Nike’s global supply chain.', 'The candidate needs to be a dependable teammate and a self-motivated data evangelist. You are unconventionally curious, especially about how data can be used to optimize the planning and management of Nike’s multi node (or multi echelon) inventory. You enjoy finding clarity and identifying relationships between disparate data sets in a muddied data environment. You are highly proficient in SQL and visualization tools (such as Tableau/Excel/Power BI), experienced in a variety of scripting languages, well-versed in automation techniques, and at home in a cloud based big data environment. You have a healthy degree of skepticism and the ability to speak data truth to power. You also know how to rise above the numbers and explain the essential insights to business users, and you instinctively minimize complexity to focus on results. While you rely on data to prove your point, you love to think in an unexpected way and solve problems creatively. You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, and you are excited by the challenge of building something from the ground up. You ask good questions, are continually learning as well as finding opportunities to share knowledge with others.', 'If this is you, you will be part of the Supply and Multi Node Inventory Optimization (S&MN) squad that delivers data science / operations research products to support Nike’s critical supply and inventory planning (S&IP) decisions, including integrated multi-node fulfillment, multi echelon inventory planning, and performance management. Specifically, you will:', 'You will report to the Director of Data Science while partner on daily basis with the fellow data scientists, data analysts, engineers, and product owner on your squad. You will collaborate across the broader organization with business teams in Demand and Supply Management (DSM) and Marketplace Operations (MPO), as well as other data, analytics, and technology functions at Nike.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Identify and apply appropriate methods to acquire, explore, cleanse, and fuse data from different sources.', 'Produce datasets, insights, visualization, and reports for analysis using system reporting tools.', 'Translate complex business problem statements into analysis requirements and work with internal customers to define the analytic product details based on expressed partner needs.', 'Develop quantitative research to identify, explore, troubleshoot, and solve problems related to data coverage and quality.', 'Build and implement reporting tools and ad hoc analysis to pull together relevant data, provide trending/KPI reporting, and evaluate metrics to drive business against established goals.', 'Participate in the development of new analytical models and improve existing approaches based on operations research techniques and big data solutions to determine optimal level of inventory, capacity, and supply plan.', 'Support a portfolio of consumers and related analytics projects with multiple business partners on firm deadlines.', 'Synthesize and package complex analyses, making them understandable across technical and non-technical audiences', "Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or other related fields.", 'Minimum 2 years of relevant professional experience with an emphasis on building data and analytical products. Supply chain/Logistics or Retail industry experience strongly preferred.', 'Proficient in data wrangling, SQL skills, and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau/Power BI).', 'Demonstrable ability to sift through data, understand statistical analysis, identify critical information, and develop solution options.', 'Demonstrated ability to think critically and seamlessly collaborate with business process owners, and data science and engineering partners.', 'Working knowledge of Scrum and agile principles.', 'Experience in data analysis/visualization packages in R or Python is a plus.', 'Experience with Git and Amazon Web Services preferred.', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to develop and deliver presentation.']
pros: ['"Flexible work environment, amazing benefits, fast pace" (in 11 reviews)', '"Healthy and positive work environment" (in 17 reviews)', '"Amazing people" (in 6 reviews)', '"Amazing culture, can’t beat working at this amazing company." (in 7 reviews)', '"flexible schedule, on" (in 8 reviews)']
cons: ['"Nothing at all, it was a great work environment." (in 17 reviews)', '"Staff native culture doesn\'t let some adjust to Nike culture." (in 7 reviews)']

This role will lead “the voice of the Jordan consumer” and provide meaningful data-based insights. job_title: Head, ShinrAI Center for Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning
descriptions_txt: ['By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.', 'At Takeda, we are a forward-looking, world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments, we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide.', "Join Takeda as a Head, ShinrAI Center for Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning. Takeda's ShinrAI Center for AI/ML is the newly created Center of Excellence for AI/ML. Shinrai is the Japanese word for trust. The ShinrAI Center for AI/ML represents the hub of data scientists, statisticians, and data engineers that will build algorithms that can be trusted by peers, colleagues, and patients. As part of the Data Architecture and Digital Solutions team, you will report to the Head of Data Architecture and Digital Solutions.", 'At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.', 'Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.', 'Absent an approved religious or medical reason, all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment, absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility, and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab, may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application, we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied.', 'In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.', '#LI-SGM', 'EEO Statement', 'Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.']

descriptions_txt: ['Piper Companies is seeking a Fully Remote Data Scientist to join one of the nation’s largest premier credit unions. The Data Scientist will implement quantitative models to analyze credit and prepayment risk, determine the allowance for loan losses, and support financial planning.', 'Responsibilities of the Data Scientist include:', 'Qualifications for the Data Scientist include:', 'Compensation for the Data Scientist include:', 'Keywords:', 'Data, data science, R, sas, python, datasets, logistic regression, linear regression, survival analysis, time series analysis, decision trees, cluster analysis, real estate, auto, credit card, consumer lending, consumer banking, modeling, model implementation, model risk, documentation, prepayment risk, financial services,']

descriptions_txt:
["Interactive Consulting Services, Inc.'s (ICS) mission is to match elite talent with cutting-edge technologies and projects.", 'Interactive Consulting Services (ICS) is headquartered in Jarrettsville, MD, and has been providing IT and talent services for over 20 years. ICS has a proven track record in both the public and private sectors, providing talent and solutions in fields ranging from healthcare, education, and finance, to social services, defense, and aviation.', 'Responsibilities:', '· Develop data mining and collection procedures', '· Create and manage the big data research environment', '· Ensure data quality and integrity', '· Productize machine learning algorithms', '· Visualize data and create reports from production systems', '· Deploy and monitor production systems', '· Ensure system scalability for new algorithms and product updates', 'Description:', 'We are searching for a Lead Data Engineer to lead engineering activities for a high-tech research and development team. This individual will help us implement a system to interpret large quantities of medical records using the latest cutting-edge technologies. This is a long-term project for a major federal agency. To be successful in this position, you should have strong problem-solving skills and an expert understanding of both statistical analysis and engineering. You should also enjoy researching and implementing the latest data science algorithms and tools. job_title: Senior Director, Digital Experience Data Science
descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR', 'We are looking for a seasoned data science leader for our Digital Experiences Data Science team. The Senior Director of Digital Experiences role will be responsible for leading the data science teams that work on optimizing and personalizing Nike’s digital experiences. These experiences include both Nike.com and on the Nike app in the United States, China, Europe, and elsewhere around the globe, as well as Nike’s SNKRS and WeChat apps. Today, this body of work is focused on using machine learning for search relevance and product recommendations. The aim is to leverage data science more broadly across these digital platforms.', 'WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON', 'You will…', 'WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH', 'You will be the leader of the Digital Experiences Data Science team, reporting to the Vice President of Consumer Data Science. Digital Experiences Data Science is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science sub-function and Insights and Analytics function. So you will be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike, and help organize and participate in our data science labs, study groups, and team activities, and attend conferences.', 'WHAT YOU BRING', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Partner closely with the other data science leaders within Consumer Data Science. This includes aligning Digital Experience Data Science roadmaps with our those of the data science teams working in the areas of sport activity, content planning, and marketing communications. Reuse data and models where possible.', 'Partner closely with Nike’s Digital Product Management leadership, providing input into the overall digital roadmaps, and in particular helping to identify and advocate for high leverage uses of data and data science across Nike’s digital experiences.', 'Partner closely with Nike’s Global Technology leadership that works on data engineering, platform engineering, and experience engineering. Ensure that the foundational data, systems, and processes are in place to successfully execute on data science.', 'Evaluate the evolving landscape of vendors of data science capabilities for ecommerce and develop a position on which capabilities should be built in house.', 'Lead through leaders, including our search and personalization data science leaders and teams that are in place today and who will report into this role.', 'Be an inspirational thought leader within the broader analytics and data science communities at Nike.', 'Hire, onboard, and mentor talented data scientists and data science leaders.', 'Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams.', 'Experience managing through senior managers.', 'Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists.', 'Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders.', 'Experience practicing data science, even if not recently.', 'A product and entrepreneurial mindset.', 'Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education, experience and training.']
