descriptions_txt:
['Job Description: Teaching Assistant, Amazon Career Choice', 'Apply Here: https://bit.ly/amazon-TA', 'About the Role:', 'Teaching Assistants play a key role in Correlation One’s world-class data training and jobs programs. In partnership with Amazon, Correlation One is launching two training programs to train Amazon frontline workers in data skills, giving them access to new, higher-paying jobs. Teaching Assistants in this program will not just share knowledge, but also inspire a class of highly motivated Fellows.', 'Thursdays (3-5 EST) and Saturdays (12-5 EST) between March 19th and August 13th (with scheduled breaks and holidays off).', 'EST), Thursdays (3-5 EST) and Saturdays (12-5 EST) between April 4th and August 28th (with scheduled breaks and holidays off).', 'As a Teaching Assistant, you will provide training for participants by answering questions via live chat during lectures, and hosting one-on-one and small group sessions with ~25 assigned participants. This small participant-to-teacher ratio is critical to the experience, letting TAs develop close participant bonds.
Participants in the program will have some foundational skills with Excel and general computer literacy skills but will have minimal to basic technical skills prior to entering the program. The curriculum mainly includes Microsoft Excel, with minor Tableau, SQL, and Python. We encourage applicants with skills in any or all of the above technologies.', 'The ideal candidate will be an excellent educator with a passion for teaching and motivating students, especially adult learners. The role is fully remote.', 'The mission of this program is to help Amazon Associates in entry level warehousing and fulfillment center roles upskill their data analysis abilities in order to find higher-paying positions in fields like data analysis, marketing, product, and more. Many of the participants in the program come from non-traditional educational backgrounds and low-income origins.', 'Core Responsibilities:', 'Some skills we consider critical to the role:', 'Compensation
This role offers $7,000 in salary plus a $3,000 adjustable performance bonus. We’re generous with our bonuses and offer additional earning opportunities.', 'The Hiring Process:
Our goal is to move very quickly in hiring this role. The entire process will occur over 1-2 weeks. The process comprises four stages:', '1. Complete an Application Form
2. Technical Assessment
3. One-way Video Interview
4. Final Round Live Interview', 'How to apply
Are you interested? Please Complete an Application Form here: https://bit.ly/amazon-TA', 'About Correlation One:', 'Correlation One is an education technology company whose mission is to create equal access to jobs in', 'data, analytics, and other skills of the future.', 'We have developed a new model for education that eliminates traditional barriers to opportunity. We run university-level programs that are 100% free for Fellows, financed by enterprises that train or recruit program graduates. This model aligns incentives between the education provider, Fellow, and employer, where everyone wins through job placement and upskilling.', 'Example programs include Data Science for All, a masters-level data science bootcamp for individuals from historically underrepresented groups, and Amazon Career Choice, an analytics training program for frontline warehouse workers.', 'Our model is not just more equitable, but it is also inherently more scalable than traditional education providers. Each program is taught by tier-1 instructors and teaching assistants, delivered virtually to cohort-based learning communities. We currently run programs for 5,000+ students each year in 10+ countries, and we plan to grow 5-10x in the next two years.', 'Our clients include over 50 blue-chip companies, such as Amazon, Citadel, Accenture, Target, EY,', 'BlackRock, Gilead, Match Group, Point72, SoftBank, TIAA and Johnson & Johnson.', 'These organizations work with us to train their own employees, to recruit program graduates, and to proactively invest in the next generation.', 'Job Types: Part-time, Contract', 'Pay: $40.00 - $45.00 per hour', 'Benefits:', 'Schedule:', 'Supplemental Pay:', 'Education:', 'Work Location: Remote']
descriptions_list: ['The Data Analytics Program is held over the course of 16 weeks on Tuesdays (3-5 EST),', 'The Logistics & Supply Chain Program is held over the course of 16 weeks on Tuesdays (3-5', 'Instruct your cohort of 25 participants assigned to you in the program; participants are sorted into 5-person Learning Teams, which work together to complete a capstone project during the course', 'Attend 16 weeks of classes on Tuesdays & Thursdays (optional), and Saturdays, and contribute by:', 'Answering live questions via Slack during lectures', 'Individual training sessions with your participants, to clarify concepts', 'Advise Learning Teams on their project work, steering them to deliver highly impactful outcomes', 'Collaborate as needed with other Teaching Assistants', 'The role is fully remote. Our class is taught in a “Live Online” format primarily via Zoom and Slack.', 'Program dates:', 'Data Analytics: March 19th-August 13th', 'Logistics & Supply Chain: April 4th-August 28th', 'Minimum 4-year college degree or equivalent experience', 'Reliable, with solid organizational skills', 'Familiarity with either Excel, Python, Tableau and/or SQL', 'Personable, approachable, and a good sense of humor', 'An affinity for communicating with others in an empathetic and considerate manner', 'Proactive problem-solver, high attention to detail, and a quick learner', 'Passion for building a solid business with a mission to change lives through training', 'Flexible schedule', 'Day shift', 'On call', 'Weekend availability', 'Bonus pay', "Bachelor's (Required)"]

descriptions_txt: ['Description', 'Looking for an exciting career change? Look no further as Leidos is looking for a Data Scientist to work in Arlington, VA.', 'Data is a foundational component of nearly all Leidos sponsored contracts and operations. To improve project performance and maximize the use of Leidos talent and resources, a Leidos data strategy, with common approaches to Data Governance (DG), Data Management (DM), architectural patterns, and discriminating technologies, is needed to support CY2022+ enterprise performance goals. You will work collaboratively across the BUs and with OOT projects to formulate an evolutionary Leidos data strategy, tailored to business needs. Key activities include quantitative/qualitative analysis of existing sponsored project practices in DG and DM to formulate discriminating technologies and improved processes of common concern.', 'LInC']
descriptions_list: ['Assist in refining and implementing a DG and DM framework to assess current practices on selected Leidos sponsored projects. Data may be collected from structured interviews, review of project documentations, discussions with SMEs, and affiliated data collection methods. Data types might include project data, cost-schedule-risk representations, project structured/unstructured datasets with diverse data types, and/or large data sets obtained from a variety of transactional and streaming sources from sponsored projects or from corporate data holdings.', 'Develop and use advanced statistical concepts, algorithms, querying and automated processes to understand DG/DM methods and techniques across datasets to identify potential common approaches and methods that inform an evolving data strategy.', 'Identifies meaningful insights, interpret, and communicate findings and recommendations. May develop information tools (dashboards), briefings, dynamic webpages, reports, or other methods to summarize with the intent to improve business and discriminating technology performance.', 'Maintains awareness of emerging data analytics and big-data technologies.', 'Familiarity with the basic principles of data analytics/data science disciplines such as Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Predictive modeling, Statistical Analysis and Hypothesis testing.', 'Program Management experience, including knowledge of Confluence/JIRA tracking systems, and other program management tools, e.g., agile methods and Kanban.', 'Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Applied Economics, or related field with at least 8+ years of relevant experience', 'Program Management certification', 'Experience working in collaborative work environments, including collegial skills to elicit requirements and develop understanding of complex DG and DM needs', 'Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Power BI, SQL, Tableau, Excel, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets', 'Experience working with and creating data models to support data science inquiries', 'Superior verbal and written communications skills spanning project management disciplines, data analytics, and technical terms', 'Knowledge of Leidos business area and domains', 'Graduate degree or equivalent certificate in Statistics, Data Science, Policy Formulation, or related field', 'Responsible for entire projects or processes spanning multiple DG and DM areas, analytic techniques, and summary of findings and insights', 'Experience with complex problem analysis and innovative solution paths in a data-rich environment', 'Communications skills commensurate with findings and insights provided to senior executives, including Board of Director levels', 'Clearance – not required, but able to obtain one, if desired']

descriptions_list: ['Lead efforts to evaluate impact of our programs and services and demonstrate impact to customers and through Marketing efforts.', 'Support projects with data insights that improve our organizational decision-making, business and program performance, and patient and pharmacists experience.', 'Build and maintain dashboards that enable a culture of self-service data access and literacy, manage ad hoc reporting requests, and collaborate with organizational stakeholders to execute data analytics projects and share resulting business insights.', 'Identify and adopt best practices in data science, reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, machine learning, predictive modeling, validation, and documentation.', 'Build, train, deploy and maintain statistical models, supporting a wide variety of use cases from a next best action recommendation engine for our pharmacists to predicting poor medication outcomes for our patients and recommending appropriate interventions most likely to make an impact.', 'Connect outcomes of the models built to drive business results and proactively make refinements to the model to course correct if needed. job_title: Senior Director, Member Modeling Data Science
descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'Member Modeling Data Science is part of Nike’s Insights function. So you will also be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike, and participate in our data science labs, study groups, and activities, and attend conferences.', 'What you bring', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Lead a talented team of Data Science Directors and Sr Data Scientists. Hire, onboard, and develop additional data scientists and data science directors.', 'Lead workstreams that require cross-functional squads that include data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and product managers.', 'Manage our portfolio of member model capabilities, including lifetime value, segmentation, fraud, and onboarding models.', 'Develop methods and tools that further enrich Nike’s member data while also respecting the privacy of our members.', 'Expand the vision for member modeling at Nike. Learn the business of designing shoes and apparel and bringing them to market around the globe to understand how to best serve stakeholders.', 'Be a part of the broader data science community within Nike and contribute to a culture of learning.', 'Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists.', 'Experience leading through leaders (directors will report into you).', 'Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams.', 'Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders.', 'Experience practicing data science.', 'A product and entrepreneurial mindset.', 'Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education, experience and training.']

descriptions_txt: ['Solutions driven success.', 'XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. As part of our growing, dynamic team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.', 'Pay, benefits and more.', 'We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.', 'What you’ll do on a typical day:', 'What you need to succeed at XPO:', 'At a minimum, you’ll need:', 'It’d be great if you also have:', 'Be part of something big.', 'We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. descriptions_txt: ['At Sanofi we are looking for a motivated Data Scientist with experience on the marketing and customer engagement domains in order to join the Customer & Consumer Data science team.', 'The new Data scientist will actively participate in strategic projects that will shape how Sanofi interacts with its patients and its customers. The ideal candidate has experience in marketing DS projects such as market mix models, demand forecasting, promotion-response analysis and key-driver analysis. The candidate will be joining an international heterogeneous team and will be joining interdisciplinary projects together with other scientists, engineers, marketing experts and buisness leads.', 'A Data Scientist II is an emerging talent with curiosity to answer questions through data exploration and modeling. He/she will develop models & AI data products applied to a broad range of business use cases related to commercial and customer analytics. Results of this work will be realized in a variety of ways, including interactive visualizations, presentations, publications, web applications, predictive algorithms, and APIs.', 'Data Scientist II Responsibilities:', 'Essential experience and characteristics:', 'Desirable experience:', 'This role will be situated and aligned with the Sanofi Data Science job function and role.', 'At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.']

Description:', 'Requirements:', 'Public trust security clearance is the lowest level of additional background screening that the federal government requires for applicants of certain jobs, which includes completing a Standard Form 85 (SF85) form.

The Baer Group prides itself on our ability to work directly with key stakeholders to create the most optimized service experience possible for our consultants and our clients. TBG’s job requirements are carefully vetted and are typically associated with mission critical programs offering tremendous opportunities to expand your skills leveraging the latest solutions. TBG focuses on representing jobs that provide streamlined response to our proposed candidates and a best in class engagement experience.

descriptions_txt: ['Discover. A brighter future.', "With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.", 'Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.', 'TITLE: Lead Data Science Analyst', 'DUTIES: Discover Products, Inc. seeks Lead Data Science Analyst in Riverwoods, IL to lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics including customer segmentation, optimization, prescriptive analytics and machine learning algorithm and recommendation to solve business problems. Operate as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling and application, and financial impact analysis. Collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables, and presentations. Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information. Establish and maintain effective performance tracking. Identify improvement opportunity, form hypotheses, propose, design, and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization. Manage multiple priorities, communicate business performance and project progress to management and business partners. Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs. Facilitate implementation of work product and ensure accuracy. Consistently follow standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommend improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining quality of work. Continuously improve technical and leadership skills through training and development. Promote a risk-aware culture to ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes.', 'REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Finance, Analytics, Statistics, or a related field and four (4) years of experience in job offered or related occupation: extracting data from Teradata, Hadoop, and Snowflake utilizing SQL, SAS, and Python; analyzing exploratory data to identify targeted segments to design and test experiments for business outcomes; utilizing statistical methodologies including correlation, regression, clustering to find patterns and relationships among key indicator variables; performing cost benefit analysis and projections for expected financial benefits and results; preparing scorecards and data visualizations to monitor and track performance of implemented strategies; and preparing and presenting summaries of performance indicators and results. In the alternative, Discover will accept a Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in the above listed fields and two (2) years of experience in the above-listed areas.', 'QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet.', 'What are you waiting for? Apply today!', 'The same way we treat our employees is how we treat all applicants – with respect. Discover Financial Services is an equal opportunity employer (EEO is the law). We thrive on diversity & inclusion. You will be treated fairly throughout our recruiting process and without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status in consideration for a career at Discover.']

descriptions_txt: ["In Vanguard's Client Experience & Digital (CXD) department, our goal is to evolve and enhance our clients’ digital experience. CXD Data and Analytics team deepens the understanding of Vanguard’s investors, drives strategic decision making, and enhances client experience by leveraging data and advanced analytics.", 'As an experienced leader, the Data Science Manager plays a critical role in influencing and driving innovation through the design and implementation of advanced experimentation and predictive analytics into business & digital solutions.', 'In this role you will lead a team of Data Scientists who are responsible for working with journey owners, analysts, and data engineers to understand business needs, define data requirement, propose and deliver analytical solutions. You will also attract talents, bring cutting edge techniques to CXD, and help propel the CXD Data Science team to be industry leading.', 'Core Responsibilities', '1. Hires, evaluates, and supervises crew. Provides guidance and training as necessary to develop crew. Sets performance standards, reviews performance, and makes informed compensation decisions in accordance with all applicable Human Resources policies and procedures.', '2. Oversees and engages in deep dive diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics to support data-driven business decision making. Creates alternative model approaches to assess complex model design and advance future capabilities.', "3. Manages a team of data analysts and newer data scientists responsible for a portfolio of diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics projects to support data-driven business decision making. Supports the continuous evolution and strategy of Vanguard's data science capabilities.", '4. Identifies and diagnoses data inconsistencies and errors, documents data assumptions, and forages to fill data gaps.', '5. Engages with internal stakeholders to understand and probe business processes in order to develop hypotheses. Brings structure to requests and translates requirements into an analytic approach.', '6. Guides test design, research design, and model validation. Provides statistical consultation services. Serves as the analytics expert on cross functional teams for large strategic initiatives and contributes to the growth of the Vanguard analytic community.', '7. Executes operational plans to achieve department objectives. Collaborates with department or functional heads in planning, developing, and executing near-term goals.', '8. Prepares, reviews, and delivers insight presentations and action recommendations. Communicates complex analytical findings and implications to business leaders.', '9. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.', 'Qualifications', 'About Vanguard', 'We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.', 'For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.', 'We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.', 'Inclusion Statement', 'Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”', 'We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.', "When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.", 'Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.', 'Future of Work', 'During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.', 'As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.', 'When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).', 'The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.']

Graduate degree preferred.']

descriptions_txt: ['At S5, we are on a mission to make Advanced Data Science consumable to Business Users. S5 is a SaaS software provider of AI/ML-powered products which transform planning and decision making capabilities across the digital supply chain for the Retail and CPG industries.', 'To support our aggressive growth, we are actively seeking talent (at multiple levels) to join our team.', 'The Role:', 'We’re looking for a customer-facing Implementation Consultant who loves helping people, solving problems, and wants to play a major role in the success of our clients. You have a strong technical aptitude, extensive client-facing experience, and are comfortable in a fast-paced working environment. You will be responsible for scoping requirements, working with clients to integrate our solutions, and deploying our solutions for our largest enterprise clients. You will be joining a team of implementation consultants and project managers who are passionate about our customers, solutions, and products.', 'What You’ll Do:', 'What We’re Looking For:', 'What’s in it for You?', 'At S5, you will get an opportunity to truly innovate while working with some of the smartest brains in the industry to solve existing and emerging business problems. Additionally, you will play a key role in defining the next generation work culture and work ethic to solve problems that others thought - simply impossible.', 'There’s never been a more exciting time to join our team!', 'Job Type: Full-time', 'Job Type: Full-time', 'Pay: $68,304.00 - $130,811.00 per year', 'Benefits:', 'Schedule:', 'Education:', 'Work Location: Remote']

descriptions_txt: ['Job Posting: GILDJP00011196 (Gilead)', 'Job Title: Clinical Research Scientist - II', 'Location: Foster City, California', 'Shift: 1st Shift', 'Contract: 6 Months with possible extension', 'Description:', 'Research Scientist (RWE Analytics- Contingent) - Molecular Epidemiology', 'The Biomarker Sciences department at Gilead is dedicated to conduct biomarker and translational research to further understanding of specific aspects of biology, inform research, development and pipeline decisions, and advance the effectiveness of available therapies in appropriate patient populations. The Molecular Epidemiology team supports biomarker activities by integrating real-world data and epidemiologic evidence within the biomarker discovery and development strategy.', 'Research Scientist, under the supervision of Molecular Epidemiology Head within the Biomarker Sciences, will be responsible for conduct and analysis of epidemiology studies using observational real-world databases. The position is expected to work across therapeutic areas that include oncology, virology, and immunology.', 'Responsibilities: Responsibilities will include, but not limited to, the following:', '· To lead analysis of epidemiologic studies using large administrative and electronic health records (EHR) data including clinico-genomic and specialized EMR data to support biomarker and drug development activities.', '· To work with lead epidemiologist to develop analysis plan for RWD studies', '· To work with functional partners to access Gilead RWD data repositories and conduct analysis in compliance with company policies', '· To work collaboratively on multi-functional projects and interact with biomarker scientists and scientists from other functions including clinical pharmacology, biology, bioinformatics, clinical research, and clinical data science on a regular basis.', '· To effectively communicate study findings through internal presentations, assist in drafting conference abstracts and manuscripts for publication in peer reviewed journals.', 'Qualifications:', '· Candidates should have a doctoral degree in epidemiology, statistics, data science, health or other relevant fields with at least 2 years or master’s degree with at least 5 years of relevant post-degree experience, preferably in pharma/biotech or related research organizations/academia', '· Should have experience in developing analysis plan and conducting analysis for observational studies using real-world EMR or claims data or large observational data. Experience with multi-omics database and/or experience in molecular epidemiology studies is a plus', '· Should have a good grasp of statistical methodology required for observational studies (descriptive, bivariate and multivariate statistics). Should have proficiency with statistical software (SAS, R, etc.) and programming. Experience in applying novel analytical or computational (machine learning) technique and data science expertise to integrate and mine large complex data is a plus.', '· Candidates are expected to have familiarity with large healthcare databases including electronic health records, specialized EMR databases, and claims data. Knowledge of clinico-genomic and publicly available genomic databases (e.g., TCGA) is a plus.', '· Should have general knowledge of drug discovery and development process.', '· Should have good oral and written communication skills demonstrated by a track record of publication(s) in major scientific journals and presentations in national or international conferences.', '· Candidates are expected to have the ability to work mostly independently in collaboration with lead epidemiologist or other functional partners', '· Candidates are expected to work in a diverse, collaborative cross-functional environment\nRequired Years of Experience: 2 years with Doctoral degree/5 years with Master’s degree', '. Top 3 Required Skill Sets: Statistical programming (SAS, R, etc), statistical methods, real-world data experience', 'Top 3 Nice to Have Skill Sets: Clinico-genomic data experience, experience in designing and leading epidemiologic studies, experience with public genomic dataset (TCGA)', '. Unique Selling Point of this role: Work in a matrix and innovative environment to get diverse experience', '1Task break down (by %): Analysis plan development (20%), Analysis (70%), Misc. (10%)', 'Contract length: 6 months', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Schedule:', 'Ability to commute/relocate:', 'Application Question(s):', 'Education:', 'Work Remotely:']

descriptions_txt: ['List Fulfillment Assistant - DMI', 'A career that makes a difference!', "RKD Group is a leading fundraising and marketing services provider to hundreds of nonprofit organizations, including hospitals, social service, health, disease research, animal welfare, and faith-based charities. ['Who We Are:', 'Anvl is on a mission to deliver a connected experience for the deskless workforce. Our solutions are used on a daily basis by Fortune 500 and Global 2000 companies across North America to make a difference every day in safety, quality, and productivity.', 'Our partners and customers work with Anvl to intervene on behalf of front line workers using leading edge mobile technology, data science, language processing, and dynamic workflows. We need innovative thinkers to design, build, and deliver a high quality and robust Enterprise workforce solution.', 'By leveraging the latest in emerging technologies, we bring practical solutions to businesses of all sizes. Our team members work in a collaborative environment and we are committed to providing an employee experience with opportunities every day to identify new challenges, innovate, design, build, deliver and grow.', 'We are building a high-caliber, fast-paced team to deliver on our mission. You can make a difference in the lives of others every day - come join us!', 'What We Value:
People First - We empower everyone to do their best work.
Outcomes Matter - We deliver on our commitments.
Driven to Improve - We challenge boundaries and continuously learn together.', 'What You Will Do:', 'The Director of Marketing at Anvl is the driver of omnichannel, full funnel, high impact experiences that engage our multiple personas and generate an ever increasing number of SALs. This person will have an innate desire - and proven ability - to improve marketing’s performance month over month while operating as a dynamic “doer”, capable of analyzing and understanding, creating and executing, and managing projects and people.', 'Our Marketing Director will work closely with Product, Sales, and Customer Success to enable near-term goals. The right person will have demonstrated experience in designing account-based experiences for target enterprises, knowing what content is needed, when, where, and in what medium to maximize lead velocity. This role will also require the ability to manage the core marketing technology stack (anchored by Hubspot) and ensure the responsible growth and stability of the stack as well as our contact database and the associated data.', 'Ideally this person will have marketing experience in a SaaS organization that sells and services clients directly as well as via channel partners.', 'What We Are Looking For:', 'Job Type: Full-time', 'Benefits:', 'Education:', 'Experience:', 'Work Location: Remote']

descriptions_txt:
['Senior Scientist Virtual R&D

Job Description

We are seeking a Senior Scientist to provide technical expertise, depth, and project leadership in the area of modeling and simulation. The position entails working with business unit teams to understand and define modeling and simulation problems and how the results will be operationalized. The focus of the techniques will be on computational fluid dynamics and machine learning. The candidate will have advanced skills in these spaces and a demonstrated history of solving complex problems through the application of these tools.

Candidates should have extensive scientific and technology experience and notable accomplishments in modeling and simulation as well as demonstrated skills in the use of associated tools such as CFD software packages, machine learning and scripting (OpenFOAM and/or Python). Experience in application of these capabilities to industrial applications is preferred.

The candidate will act as a source of direction, training and guidance for other team members. The person should be knowledgeable in industry best practices in their area of expertise and use resources outside of K-C to deliver solutions. The successful candidate will be a self-starter expert with the ability to work at the front end of data science development, but just as importantly will have a demonstrated ability to drive and implement technical process through strong collaborative interaction with internal teams and external partners.

Responsibilities :

Assess business problems and develop a technical approach to using modeling and simulation to address the issue that considers time constraints, resource limitations and any operational issues. Independently and as part of a team develop approaches and solutions to improving the modeling and simulation capability of the team, including data management. Work with internal IT teams, vendors and other internal parties to execute solutions. Keep abreast of latest developments in data science analysis: statistical techniques, emerging software platforms, and data experimental design. Research new techniques/methods to drive biological data manipulation and integration with other programs. Leveraging technical depth, coach junior team members to build the department’s scientific talent in the area of data science. Provide protection to technologies, processes, materials, and products through appropriate use of internal technical reports, patents, and trade secrets. Conduct all communications and transactions with the utmost integrity and honesty to build an unimpeachable business reputation. Ensure communication of project plans and results to partners, customers, and other team members. Contribute to an environment in which all team members are respected regardless of their individual differences and are motivated to improve both their individual and team contributions to achieve desired business results. Visibly demonstrate that safety is a value by following safety procedures, maintaining a safe workplace and complying with safety rules. Develop equipment, processes, materials, and products that meet safety codes, policies and guidelines. Actively participate in achieving organization and personal safety objectives.

Position Qualifications:

A preferred Candidate possesses an advanced degree in relevant major scientific or engineering discipline from an accredited college or university. Relevant degrees include: Physics, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering or Mathematics. 5-10 years research experience in a variety of technical assignments with emphasis in the application of modeling and simulation tools in the solving of business and operational issues. Demonstrated expertise in the use of commercial or open-source computational fluid dynamics packages in solving problems. Experience with meshing complex geometries for CFD is preferred, as well as computational geometry tools and approaches. Experience in porous media flow in highly porous materials is a plus. Advanced knowledge of scientific principles, scientific analysis, and project management. A working knowledge of the physics of fluid dynamics and associated problems. The ability to use the fundamental physics of systems to define modeling requirements and underlying relationships inherent in a problem. Previous experience or capability to develop subroutines for commercial code (e.g., PDE solvers) would be highly preferred. Experience with scripting in OpenFOAM, R, Mathematica, Matlab, MathCad and/or Python. Experience working on problems in an industrial environment is preferred, particularly in the areas of high-speed manufacturing and consumer products. Demonstrated expertise in the use of commercial or open-source machine learning packages would be beneficial. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required to convey complex research in a high impact manner to scientists as well as business leaders. Skills in the areas of collaboration, innovation, decisiveness, and conflict resolution are important for success as is working with blended teams consisting of employees, vendors, and consultants. Possess strong leadership skills and exhibit creative thinking to be able to come up with inventive solutions to solve scientific and business challenges Must be able to work and lead in a team environment to meet aggressive deadlines. Willing to travel 10-20% of the time - occasional international travel possible.

Kimberly-Clark makes the essentials for a better life with well-known brands that matter every day - at home, school, work and on the go. Throughout our 148 years, we have challenged conventional wisdom to innovate products that better meet the needs of consumers. We have created new categories with top brands like Kleenex®, and redefined categories with Huggies® and U by Kotex®. While growing our $18+ billion global business, we help build careers through collaborative teams that push boundaries and endless opportunities to work with some of the world’s most recognized brands. Our 43,000 employees are changing the world for the better, too, generously giving back to communities and causes around the globe. The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. descriptions_txt:
['Lowe’s Technology organization believes that in-person collaboration is highly effective and helps build relationships and strengthens our culture. As such, we are leveraging an Open Office approach in how we work, meaning our tech associates will leverage time in the office to focus on highly collaborative activities as well as some remote / work from home time for autonomous endeavors. Each role has different business-driven collaboration needs that will require in-office presence.', 'The primary purpose of this role is to provide advanced analytical capabilities to support data science
initiatives. This position gains experience in various areas including, but not limited to: predictive modeling; personalization and recommendation algorithms; natural language processing and text mining; search recall, precision, ranking, and related problems; optimization and mathematical programming with applications in labor scheduling, inventory and capacity planning, network flows, and supply chain optimization.
A Senior Data Scientist solves complex problems that do not yet have solutions in the research. Therefore, the individual in this role must be an expert in his/her field and confident in interacting and proposing solutions to the business. This role influences the thought process and methodology for other team members.

Responsibilities:', 'About Lowe’s:
Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 18 million customers a week in the United States and Canada. With fiscal year 2019 sales of $72.1 billion, Lowe’s and its related businesses operate or service more than 2,200 home improvement and hardware stores and employ approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe’s supports its hometown Charlotte region and all communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.

About Lowe’s in the Community:
As a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company, Lowe’s is committed to creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts through nonprofit partnerships. Across every community we serve, Lowe’s associates donate their time and expertise through the Lowe’s Heroes volunteer program. For the latest news, visit Newsroom.Lowes.com or follow @LowesMedia on Twitter.']

job_title: Senior Director, Digital Experience Data Science
descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR', 'We are looking for a seasoned data science leader for our Digital Experiences Data Science team. The Senior Director of Digital Experiences role will be responsible for leading the data science teams that work on optimizing and personalizing Nike’s digital experiences. These experiences include both Nike.com and on the Nike app in the United States, China, Europe, and elsewhere around the globe, as well as Nike’s SNKRS and WeChat apps. Today, this body of work is focused on using machine learning for search relevance and product recommendations. The aim is to leverage data science more broadly across these digital platforms.', 'WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON', 'You will…', 'WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH', 'You will be the leader of the Digital Experiences Data Science team, reporting to the Vice President of Consumer Data Science. Digital Experiences Data Science is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science sub-function and Insights and Analytics function. So you will be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike, and help organize and participate in our data science labs, study groups, and team activities, and attend conferences.', 'WHAT YOU BRING', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']
descriptions_list: ['Partner closely with the other data science leaders within Consumer Data Science. This includes aligning Digital Experience Data Science roadmaps with our those of the data science teams working in the areas of sport activity, content planning, and marketing communications. Reuse data and models where possible.', 'Partner closely with Nike’s Digital Product Management leadership, providing input into the overall digital roadmaps, and in particular helping to identify and advocate for high leverage uses of data and data science across Nike’s digital experiences.', 'Partner closely with Nike’s Global Technology leadership that works on data engineering, platform engineering, and experience engineering. Ensure that the foundational data, systems, and processes are in place to successfully execute on data science.', 'Evaluate the evolving landscape of vendors of data science capabilities for ecommerce and develop a position on which capabilities should be built in house.', 'Lead through leaders, including our search and personalization data science leaders and teams that are in place today and who will report into this role.', 'Be an inspirational thought leader within the broader analytics and data science communities at Nike.', 'Hire, onboard, and mentor talented data scientists and data science leaders.', 'Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams.', 'Experience managing through senior managers.', 'Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists.', 'Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders.', 'Experience practicing data science, even if not recently.', 'A product and entrepreneurial mindset.', 'Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education, experience and training.']

descriptions_txt:
['Gertens Family of Businesses is seeking a Corporate Data Analyst to join our Purchasing team to mine data and present to the organization. This full-time, onsite opportunity offers competitive pay and benefits, energetic team environment, and employee discounts! Gertens is home grown right here in Minnesota and is the largest garden center in the Midwest. Come join an industry leader!', 'The Corporate Data Analyst will be responsible for database architecture around business operations; analytics including descriptive and diagnostic. The Analyst will be responsible to query the database and handle data requests of increasing complexity, with exposure to users and data from all areas of the business and communicate analysis effectively to assist in making informed business decisions. Responsible for existing reports and developing new reports using Excel and SQL Server Reporting Services.', 'Key Tasks and Responsibilities
1. Designate and maintain data systems and database.
2. Mining data from primary and secondary sources and reorganizing for appropriate presentation per requests from all areas of the business (sales, procurement, production, marketing, ecommerce, and accounting).
3. Interpretation of data sets, monitoring for trends and patterns.
4. Collaboration with company leadership, effectively communicating trends, patterns, weaknesses, and opportunities using relevant data.
5. ERP implementation projects.
6. Other tasks and special projects as assigned.', 'PI163438915']

descriptions_txt: ['About Working at Commerce', 'Wouldn’t it be great to build your career at a bank that’s known for helping people with their financial challenges? That’s exactly what you’d be doing when you join the team at Commerce Bank. We’re looking for teammates who are ready to do whatever it takes to help our customers with their everyday financial needs. You’d be helping yourself too, because Commerce has a tradition of recognizing and rewarding team members for their talent, skills and contributions.', 'No wonder we’ve been an industry leader for over 150 years and have developed a reputation as a great place to work in the financial services world. If you’d like to be a part of a team and culture that is respected by its peers and in your community, we should talk. We’re always looking for the best and brightest.', 'About This Job', 'The Data Analyst provides reporting, business intelligence and analysis to the Commercial Lines of Business and functional department management. The analyst utilizes database programming and report design to lead the business lines with the highest level of service in multiple areas including sales strategy, business strategy, technical execution, and portfolio management.', 'Serves as a business and data expert, conducting analyses and interpreting results to provide information to management for business decisions and solutions. Creates and/or maintains data models used to make business decisions. Utilizes data models to analyze data and assess impact and/or risk to the business line. Interprets results of analysis and produces reports. Ensures the accuracy and integrity of data is maintained. Assists management with designing strategies to achieve business goals based upon data analysis. Tests potential changes to current data models to assess impact.', 'Work location: "Moments that Matter!" At Commerce Bank, we believe our team members are in tune with the needs of their respective role and professional enough to know when they should be in-person. This role is categorized as hybrid/flexible; meaning, a team member may work remotely from home except for those "moments that matter" and should live within a 3-hour radius of the Kansas City or St. Louis Commerce Bank locations. We would consider a “remote” (anywhere in the US) hire for the perfect candidate!', 'Essential Functions', 'Responsible for development and scheduled releases for relationship pricing model(s) and customer level profitability', 'Develop new reports and dashboards ranging from Sales metrics to financial trends to portfolio analysis', 'Setup databases with various levels of complexity for aiding in the explanation of P&L financial variances', 'Utilized for data management type initiatives which may require pulling and sending data from one, or more, system(s) or department(s) to another', descriptions_txt: ['You may not realize it, but you’ve likely used a product today made possible by the plastics and chemicals manufactured by Chevron Phillips Chemical. From medical supplies and electronics to food packaging and cosmetics, we create the building blocks for more than 70,000 consumer and industrial products.', 'Even as a global company with 5,000 employees, we maintain a “small company feel” and uphold a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusion. Ask any Chevron Phillips Chemical employee what they like best about their job, and universally, the answer is “the people I work with!” We value work-life balance, and love to see our employees thrive both professionally and personally. There has never been a better time to work for Chevron Phillips Chemical. If you’re ready to grow with us and become part of our vision of being the premier Chemical Company, apply today!', 'Information Technology at Chevron Phillips Chemical leads our Digital Journey. The department is chartered to enable a smarter enterprise, establish a connected workforce, optimize access to key information and support our growing company. We envision technology as a means to transform the way we work, so that we become more agile, efficient and ensure a foundation that is integrated, scalable and sustainable across the enterprise. We know this is how we will succeed now and well into our future.', 'Chevron Phillips Chemical offers competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and at most locations, alternate work schedules.', 'Paper resumes will not be accepted. All job seekers must go to the web site to be considered for positions. If you are interested in applying for this position and need an accommodation to apply, please contact our Human Resources Service Center at 1-800-446-1422, option 4.', 'Chevron Phillips Chemical Company is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status or marital status.', 'To all recruitment agencies: We are not responsible for any fee related to unsolicited resumes from 3rd party staffing and recruiting agencies (whether submitted through this website or sent directly to employees) unless a written agreement is in place between the agency and Chevron Phillips Chemical Company LP (“Company”) and an authorized Company representative makes a written request to the agency to assist with this requisition. Similarly, no fee will be paid for candidates who apply and claim to be represented by an agency. Any unsolicited resumes, CVs, or other candidate information submitted by an agency will become the property of Company, and no fee will be paid in the event such candidate is hired.', 'Travel Requirements: Up to 5%', 'Eligibility for Relocation: Yes', 'Closing Date: 02/16/2022', 'Nearest Major Market: Houston\nJob Segment: Chemistry, Database, Scientific, Scientist, Engineer, Science, Technology, Engineering']

job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Emerging Areas Open to remote work, except in CO, SD, VT, AND WV
descriptions_txt: ['Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team', 'NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.', 'WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR', 'We are looking for an entrepreneurial, product-minded data scientist who is passionate about working on novel applications of data science within Nikes. Examples of emerging areas include data science for digital product design, interactive retail experiences, and sports marketing. The goal is to lay the foundation over the next few years for leveraging data and data science at scale within these spaces.', 'WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON', 'In this role, you will…', 'WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH', 'You will be a member of the Emerging Areas Data Science team. This team is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science team and Insights function. So you will be a member of the broader data science team at Nike, and participate in our data science labs, study groups, team activities, and attend conferences.', 'WHAT YOU BRING', 'Open to remote work, except cannot work in Colorado, South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.', 'NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.', 'NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.']

descriptions_txt: ['JOB DESCRIPTION', 'Insight Global is searching for a permanent, Jr. Data Science to work for one of its major financial services clients. This is an exciting opportunity to grow a career in data science/modeling with enormous opportunity for growth. The ideal candidate will have 1-3 years of hands on modeling/data science, hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field, and be a savvy communicator. This position will sit on the Auto Insurance Risk team and will report into an Actuary. (No prior insurance experience is necessary, but would be a bonus.) This team is looking to supplement its modeling capabilities and is excited to train an individual on Insurance Risk. Day to day responsibilities include: Build, document, and maintain IRM specific models to identify and assess Insurance Risk performance and risk exposure, Provide expertise to leverage D2I and Cloud computing as a platform for data analysis, Build and share expertise within IRM to Data Analysis methods and toolsets, and Maintain strong working relationships with Business Line process owners and subject matter experts.', 'MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS', 'DESIRED SKILLS']
descriptions_list: ['2-3 years of hands-on experience with model development', 'Fluent in a coding language – R, Python, Spark, Etc.', 'Sound understanding of quantitative modeling principles (i.e. linear/logistic regressions)', 'Sharp communicator – this position will interface with many different stakeholders and be collaborative. "', 'Prior experience in Insurance or Auto Loans"']

descriptions_txt: ['JOB DESCRIPTION', 'Develop and drive a QA strategy, as well as take a hands-on approach to implementing that strategy. Lead efforts to develop, document, and implement applicable QA processes and procedures to provide more effective quality methods within the group in support of providing quality products. Provides testing support for an application. Create, implement, maintain, and enhance test plans, test scripts, and test methodologies that ensure exhaustive testing of all assigned products. Develop software quality test plans and test cases, and lead in setting and maintaining the standards for Software Quality Assurance test documentation. Collaborate with Product Owners to elaborate user stories. Review upcoming requirements for impact to testing. Collaborate with developers to improve overall product quality by emphasizing defect prevention throughout the development process. Identify and analyze defects/test results and be able to deduct the chain of events leading to a failure. Communicate testing results in conjunction with test plans. Identify areas for test improvement through analysis, experience and use of metrics. Ensure that the project schedule is adhered to and the work is completed according to the schedule. Participate in daily scrum activities. Develop and implement processes to manage the deployment of applications to new clients. Executes project testing procedures and create testing deliverables, especially for acceptance testing. Identifies and maintains test data. Identifies defects, issues and concerns encountered during testing. Maintains defect reports and status during test cycles. Compares expected results to actual results and investigates and resolves discrepancies. Tracks and reports status of test execution', 'MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS', 'DESIRED SKILLS']
descriptions_list: ['Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related technical degree', 'Minimum of 2 years of experience with proven technical and professional skills in Android and related software design, development, and testing', '2+ years of experience in software quality assurance and testing Android code and backoffice distributed systems with Java/J2EE/.net and with traditional Databases and or Big data volume databases.', 'Knowledge of SOA, Microservices and or Event based Architectures.', 'Solid knowledge of testing embedded product software and software QA methodologies and tools', 'Automation Testing experience using Languages (Python/ Java/ C++)', 'Good experience with different Operating Systems, especially Linux variants', 'Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, self-motivated, quick-thinker and able to work in a fast-paced work environment', 'Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization', 'Emerging partnership and collaboration skills showing ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a fast-paced environment', 'High level of integrity, ability to deal with ambiguity, take initiative/self-directed', 'Consistent demonstration of innovative thinking that is customer-centric', 'Master’s degree in a related technical field', 'Advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field', '5+ years of experience in quality assurance', 'Experience in Automation Testing using tools (UI Automator), API Testing (JUnit)', 'Knowledge of vehicle CAN based communication and use of CAN tools - CaNoE, Vehicle Spy', 'Working knowledge of Scrum/Agile software development process', 'Outstanding verbal and written communication skill', 'Experience with edge, cloud, IoT technologies, operating systems, OS internals, OS design, virtualization technologies, containerization/container development', 'Knowledge of data science, data analytic tools, machine learning, artificial intelligence (AI)', 'Knowledge of AUTOSAR standards and methodology', 'Knowledge and experience with CAN, LIN or Ethernet communications protocol']
